excuso: <entryFree id="n16766" type="main" key="excu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cūso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excuss-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>causa; cf. accuso, from ad-causa; qs. to release from a charge, to free from blame; hence</etym>, <sense id="n16766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to excuse</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n16766.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16766.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With a personal object, aliquem alicui: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticae meae velim me ita excuses, ut omnem culpam in te transferas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui per litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">his omnibus me vehementer excusatum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:40:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 40, § 103</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titium excusavit Vespa Terentius, quod eum brachium fregisse diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libo excusat Bibulum, quod is, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum me tibi excuso in eo ipso, in quo te accuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de me excusando apud Apuleium, dederam ad te litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 75</bibl> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura, ut excuser morbi causa in dies singulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: si citatus judex non responderit excuseturque Areopagites esse, etc., <hi rend="ital">excuses himself as being</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi, cur excusatus abirem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Appuleium in dies ut excuser videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me excusatum esse apud Appuleium a Laterense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16766.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With inanim. or abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apologize for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varroni memineris excusare tarditatem litterarum mearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitum permutatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliolum, fascias, etc. (sola valetudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missos ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 397</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:256" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum Agrippinae ob imminentem partum et hiemem,</quote> <trans><tr>her not returning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16766.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16766.5" n="A" level="2"> Aliquid (alicui), i. q. se propter aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to allege in excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plead as an excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excuse one's self with.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16766.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquitatem excusavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam (with calamitatem queri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Philippo Excusare laborem et mercenaria vincla, Quod non mane domum venisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatorem se apud patres excusare solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae apud Vitellium excusanda erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusata necessitas praesentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusata rei familiaris mediocritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusatus languor faucium, propter quem non adesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16766.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prehensi sumus, excusemus, ebrios Nos fecisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 19</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 126</bibl>, the correct reading is incusato, v. Ritschl ad h. l.): <cb n="EXCU" /> excusanti, minus datum ad occultandam facinoris invidiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16766.8" n="B" level="2"> Aliquem ab aliqua re, aliqua re, or alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolve</hi> one from any thing; <hi rend="ital">to discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispense with</hi> one (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">a coepta (tutela) excusari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegarum filiorum tutela excusari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 1, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui excusari mallet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1</bibl></cit>. 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 14, 19</bibl>. But (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">se de aliqua re: legati venerunt, qui se de superioris temporis consilio excusarent, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16766.9" n="C" level="2"> Se ab aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi> one's self from any thing (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut invicom se a calore excusent (plantae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 2</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n16766.10" n="D" level="2"> Aliquid aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to compensate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atone for</hi> any thing (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nefas armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> de Bell. Get. 562</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:32:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 32, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">excūsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">excused</hi> (postAug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc et ego excusatior, si forte sum lapsus, et tu dignior laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusatissimus essem, etiamsi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excūsātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excusably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri id videtur excusate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod exoratus excusatius facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excusor: <entryFree id="n16767" type="hapax" key="excu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excudo</etym>, <sense id="n16767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coppersmith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a smith</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xalkeuth/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
excussabilis: <entryFree id="n16768" type="main" key="excussa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excussābĭlis</orth>, etc., v. excusabilis, etc.</entryFree>
excusse: <entryFree id="n16769" type="hapax" key="excusse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excusse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. excutio, <sense id="n16769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
excussio: <entryFree id="n16770" type="main" key="excussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>excutio</etym>, <sense id="n16770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 17, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excussorius: <entryFree id="n16771" type="main" key="excusso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excussōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for shaking out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribra e lino,</quote> <trans><tr>bolting-sieves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
excussus: <entryFree id="n16772" type="main" key="excussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from excutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16773" type="hapax" key="excussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>excutio</etym>, <sense id="n16773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beating</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 226.</sense></entryFree>
excusus: <entryFree id="n16774" type="main" key="excu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">excūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from excudo.</entryFree>
excutio: <entryFree id="n16775" type="main" key="excu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype> (archaic <sense id="n16775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> excussit, for excusserit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 16</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to shake out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send forth</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n16775.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16775.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">posse ex his (litteris) in terram excussis annales Ennii, ut deinceps legi possint, effici,</quote> <trans><tr>shaken out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus excussit equitem,</quote> <trans><tr>threw off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excussus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excussus curru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 590</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectis excussit utrumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatorem in mare e puppi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ancora ictu ipso excussa e nave sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapide clavum,</quote> <trans><tr>to knock off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis digitis excutiendus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:101" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem de crinibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem de manu alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:53:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 53, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelion subjectā Ossā (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma venti,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast down</tr>, <tr>shake down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:764" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 764</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nucifrangibula (i. e. dentes) excussit ex malis meis,</quote> <trans><tr>to knock out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum alicui cyatho, verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculo excusso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>: ipso cum domino calce omnes excutiamus, <hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 298, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucros vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem oppidis et regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:42" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab obsidione Nolae urbis (with pellere a Campania),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:ib. 29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras cubilibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to scare</tr>, <tr>rouse up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si flava excutitur Chloë,</quote> <trans><tr>be shaken off</tr>, <tr>cast off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(viros) excussos patriā infesta sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me excutiam atque egrediar domo,</quote> <trans><tr>take myself off</tr>, <tr>decamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartanas,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 56</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(leo) gaudet comantes Excutiens cervice toros,</quote> <trans><tr>shaking about</tr>, <tr>shaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesariem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:404" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 404</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nares inflare et movere ... et pulso subito spiritu excutere, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to blow up</tr>, <tr>dilate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (gallinae edito ovo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 57, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurl</tr>, <tr>discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen in Thebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:69" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excussaque brachia jacto,</quote> <trans><tr>tossed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 596</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) Excussit calidum flammis velocibus ignem,</quote> <trans><tr>sends out</tr>, <tr>produces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 688</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 161</bibl>: largum imbrem <cb n="EXED" /> (procellae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomitum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutior somno,</quote> <trans><tr>I am roused from sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 302</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 112</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16775.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to shake out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16775.4" n="1" level="3"> Esp. a garment, to free it from dust: <cit><quote lang="la">vexatam solo vestem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere de pulvere,</quote> <trans><tr>shake yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 52, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem de pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16775.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi> any thing to see under it; and hence, <hi rend="ital">to search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi> a person: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Di me perdant, si ego tui quicquam abstuli. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Agedum, excutedum pallium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">culcitisque et stragulis praetentatis et excussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>.—With personal objects: excutiuntur tabellarii, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verum (porcellum) ut subesse pallio contenderent Et excuti juberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non excutio te, si quid forte ferri habuisti: non scrutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16775.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16775.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shake out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force away</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes istorum delicias, omnes ineptias,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake off</tr>, <tr>discard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli aculeos orationis meae, qui reconditi sunt, excussos arbitrari,</quote> <trans><tr>plucked out</tr>, <tr>removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ista nobis studia de manibus excutiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are torn</tr>, <tr>wrested from our hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc excutere opinionem mihimet volui radicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitatem veterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: excutient tibi istam verborum jactationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excute corde metum,</quote> <trans><tr>remove</tr>, <tr>banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diros amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:426" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem paci excutere,</quote> <trans><tr>to banish peace from the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis quae erat conceptae mentis intentio mora et interdum iracundia excutitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Senecam) non equidem omnino conabar excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena negotia curo, excussus propriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo risum excutiat sibi,</quote> <trans><tr>can raise</tr>, <tr>produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16775.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicando excutiendoque verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:36:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 36, 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: pervulgata atque in manibus jactata et excussa, qs. <hi rend="ital">shaken out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">examined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12</bibl>. 26: <cit><quote lang="la">illud excutiendum est, ut sciatur quid sit carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fere omnia Cicero in crimine veneficii excutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:13" default="NO">12, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut conjecturā excutiuntur, an vera sint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">excussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">interest, utrum tela excusso lacerto torqueantur, an remissa manu effluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma excussissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">excussē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere pilam (with rigide, opp. languidius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exdecimata: <entryFree id="n16776" type="gloss" key="exde^ci^ma_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exdĕcĭmāta</orth>, v. edecimo.</entryFree>
exdemeticus: <entryFree id="n16777" type="main" key="Exdemeticus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Exdemeticus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a satire by Varro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exdico: <entryFree id="n16778" type="gloss" key="exdi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exdīco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. edico <sense id="n16778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exdorsuo: <entryFree id="n16779" type="main" key="exdorsu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-dorsŭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-dorso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dorsum; lit., to deprive of the back; hence, in partic.</etym>, of fishes, <sense id="n16779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out the backbone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bone</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">congrum, muraenam exdorsua, quantum potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces (with desquamare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 301, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exdorsuare, dorso nudare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 29</bibl></cit>: exdorsua dorsum confringe; alii, exime, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=79:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 79, 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
exdutae: <entryFree id="n16780" type="gloss" key="exdu_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exdūtae</orth> <itype>exuviae</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 2</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
exduumvir: <entryFree id="n16781" type="main" key="exdu^umvi^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-dŭumvĭr</orth>, <itype>iri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has been a duumvir</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exebenus: <entryFree id="n16782" type="main" key="exe^be^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕbĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ce/benos</foreign>, <sense id="n16782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a shining white</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
execo: <entryFree id="n16783" type="main" key="exe^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕco, exē^cror, exĕcūtio, exĕ-quor</orth>, etc., v. exsec., exsequ., etc.</entryFree>
exedo: <entryFree id="n16784" type="main" key="exe^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, ēsum</itype> (exessum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl>), 3 (archaic <sense id="n16784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praes. subj.</hi> exedint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 32</bibl>. Post-class. form of the <hi rend="ital">praes. ind.</hi> exedit, for exest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; Seren. Sammon. 7), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to eat up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16784.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum quod curculiones exesse incipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="682" /> <cb n="EXEM" /> 63, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens, qui jecur ejus exesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 55" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 55</bibl></cit>.—Proverb.: tute hoc intristi; <cit><quote lang="la">tibi omne est exedendum,</quote> <trans><tr>as you have cooked</tr>, <tr>so you must eat</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi quod intristi, exedendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Prooem. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16784.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to eat up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus id eripiet, vis aliqua conficiet aut exedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exesa scabra rubigine pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammeus ardor Silvas exederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem (undae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparebat epigramma exesis posterioribus partibus versiculorum, dimidiatis fere,</quote> <trans><tr>effaced by time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa monumenta vetustas exederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exesae arboris antrum,</quote> <trans><tr>rotten</tr>, <tr>hollow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens exesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exesa vis luminis,</quote> <trans><tr>consumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem nefandis odiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te futurum censes, quem assidue exedent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>devour</tr>, <tr>consume thy property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 53</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16784.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prey upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudo exest animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accedunt aegritudines, molestiae, maerores, qui exedunt animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi beati, quos nullae aegritudines exedunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestas exedit cura medullas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 23</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectando exedor miser atque exenteror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exedra: <entryFree id="n16785" type="greek" key="exe^dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕdra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ce/dra</foreign>, <sense id="n16785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hall furnished with seats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hall for conversing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disputing in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16785.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">exedrae spatiosae, habentes sedes, in quibus philosophi, rhetores, reliquique ... sedentes disputare possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:35:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 35, 2 al.</bibl> (v. Becker's Gallus, London ed. p. 262).—</sense><sense id="n16785.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an aviary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exedrium: <entryFree id="n16786" type="greek" key="exe^dri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕdrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ce/drion</foreign>, <sense id="n16786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parlor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exedum: <entryFree id="n16787" type="main" key="exe^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n16787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 115, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exeduratus: <entryFree id="n16788" type="hapax" key="exe_du_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ēdūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [edurus], <sense id="n16788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of hardness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuviae (with mollitae and evigoratae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exegetice: <entryFree id="n16789" type="main" key="exe_ge_ti^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exēgētĭce</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)chghtikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n16789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of interpretation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exegesis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 2, p. 421</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
exemplar: <entryFree id="n16790" type="main" key="exemplar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, (exemplare, is, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 124</bibl>, v. Lachm. ad h. l.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exemplum</etym>. <sense id="n16790.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A transcript</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16790.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: tibi earum (litterarum) exemplar misi, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber in exemplaria transcriptus mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 20, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:75:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 75, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae exemplar, quod apographon vocant,</quote> <trans><tr>a copy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr 4, 11 al.—</sense><sense id="n16790.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum amicum qui intuetur, tamquam exemplar aliquod intuetur sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et alia ingenii ejus exemplaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16790.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exemplar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an example</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eam speciem, quae semper est eadem, intuebitur, atque id sibi proponet exemplar ... videndum, utrum sit imitatus exemplar, etc. (corresp. to exemplum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad imitandum mihi propositum exemplar illud est (corresp. to exemplum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utile proposuit nobis exemplar Ulixen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui disseruerunt, sine ullo certo exemplari formaque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catoni, quo omnes, qui iisdem rebus studemus, quasi exemplari ad industriam virtutemque ducimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falcula exemplar antiquae religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitae prioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornuto quid in omni genere ad exemplar antiquitatis expressius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumtaxat, rerum magnarum parva potest res Exemplare dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicere exemplar vitae morumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decipit exemplar vitiis imitabile, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plautus ad exemplar Siculi properare Epicharmi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad exemplar primi libri bellum Siculum perscripsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulatorii dedecoris apud posteros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (epulas) a Tigellino paratas ut exemplar referam, ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>example</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac secundum exemplar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta exemplar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 30</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos exemplaria Graeca Nocturnā versate manu, versate diurnā,</quote> <trans><tr>models</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 268</bibl></cit>. <cb n="EXEM" /></sense></entryFree>
exemplare: <entryFree id="n16791" type="main" key="exempla_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. exemplar <sense id="n16791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exemplaris: <entryFree id="n16792" type="main" key="exempla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exemplum</etym>. <sense id="n16792.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That serves as a pattern</hi> or <hi rend="ital">example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exemplary</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16792.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplāres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (i. e. libri), <hi rend="ital">copies</hi> (for the usual exemplaria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Anton. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Anton. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exemplarium: <entryFree id="n16793" type="main" key="exempla_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exemplar</etym>, post-class for exemplar (cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 82</bibl>). <sense id="n16793.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A copy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">binae tabulae testamenti eodem tempore exemplarii causa scriptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Helv. 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16793.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 198</bibl>; Schol. Lucan. 9, 563.</sense></entryFree>
exemplatus: <entryFree id="n16794" type="hapax" key="exempla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exemplum</etym>, <sense id="n16794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">copied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcribed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exemplo: <entryFree id="n16795" type="main" key="exemplo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adduce as an example</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exemplum: <entryFree id="n16796" type="main" key="exemplum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>eximo</etym>, orig., what is taken out as a sample (cf. eximius, from eximo), <sense id="n16796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sample.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16796.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (cf. exemplar, specimen): <cit><quote lang="la">purpurae, tritici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16796.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16796.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An imitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portrait</hi> taken from something; <hi rend="ital">a draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcript</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16796.4" n="1" level="3"> Hic quoque exemplum reliquit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 56</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o Apella, o Zeuxis pictor, Cur numero estis mortui? hinc exemplum ut pingeretis: Nam alios pictores nihil moror hujusmodi tractare exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:102 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 102 sq.</bibl></cit>; and in a pun with the follg. signif. under B.: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Exempla edepol faciam ego in te. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Quia placeo, exemplum expetis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes probant: sibi quisque Inde exemplum expetunt,</quote> <trans><tr>a sketch</tr>, <tr>draught</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 75</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeii litterarum ad consulem exemplum attulit: Litterae mihi a L. Domitio allatae sunt: earum exemplum infra scripsi ... Deinde supposuit exemplum epistolae Domitii, quod ego ad te pridie miseram,</quote> <trans><tr>a transcript</tr>, <tr>copy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:23 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 23 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16796.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parallel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimum Homeri inluxit ingenium, sine exemplo maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16796.6" n="B" level="2"> A sample for imitation, instruction, proof, <hi rend="ital">a pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precedent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">case</hi> (the predominant meaning of the word). </sense><sense id="n16796.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mutum in simulacrum ex animali exemplo veritas transferatur,</quote> <trans><tr>from a living model</tr>, <tr>original</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">feruntur enim ex optimis naturae et veritatis exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propones illi exempla ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habere exemplum ad imitandum (corresp. to exemplar),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris exemplo fuit ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposita ad exemplum nostra re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquimur de iis amicis, qui ante oculos sunt... Ex hoc numero nobis exempla sumenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex barbatis illis exemplum imperii veteris, imaginem antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sapiente petitur exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum a me petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eodem Pompeio omnium rerum egregiarum exempla sumantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab se ipso exemplum capi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et ipse sis quasi unicum exemplum antiquae probitatis et fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in juventute habemus illustrius exemplum veteris sanctitatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua in muliere etiam nunc quasi exempli causa vestigia antiqui officii remanent,</quote> <trans><tr>as a pattern</tr>, <tr>example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 27</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum virum, unde pudoris pudicitiaeque exempla peterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmare animum constantibus exemplis (for constantiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum modestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosi principes plus exemplo quam peccato nocent,</quote> <trans><tr>by their example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tullus Hostilius) de imperio suo, exemplo Pompilii, populum consuluit curiatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem exemplo nostrae civitatis usus sum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: atrox videbatur Appi sententia; <cit><quote lang="la">rursus Vergini Larciique exemplo haud salubres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>judged by the precedent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinare morientes etiam illo exemplo confirmat Posidonius, quo affert, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>by that example</tr>, <tr>that case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1</bibl>, <cb n="EXEO" /> 30, 49; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illa et apud Graecos exempla ... levitatis Atheniensium crudelitatisque in amplissimos cives exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datum in omnes provincias exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dare exemplum,</quote> <trans><tr>to set the example</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia legio exemplum ceteris praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16796.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp. in phrase: exempli causā or gratiā, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for an example</hi> (cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 437): <cit><quote lang="la">exempli causa paucos nominavi,</quote> <trans><tr>for example's sake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia in alicujus libris exempli causa id nomen invenerant, putarunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:37:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 37, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec exempli gratia sufficient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca exempli gratia ponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:110" default="NO">5, 10, 110</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus in exemplum pauca subjeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">venit in exemplum furor,</quote> <trans><tr>teaches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:243" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 243</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16796.9" n="3" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a warning example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum statuite in me, ut adolescentuli vobis placere studeant potius quam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus liberi sunt, statuite exemplum, quantae poenae in civitate sint hominibus istiusmodi comparatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 35, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simile in superiore parte provinciae edere exemplum severitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">edere exempla in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne viderem, quae futura exempla dicunt in eum indigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet aliquid ex iniquo omne magnum exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritum quidem novissima exempla Mithridatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the punishment of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in exemplo,</quote> <trans><tr>to serve as a warning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 454</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judae, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplo supplicii reliquos deterrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:44:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16796.10" n="4" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exemplum trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui sine exemplo subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16796.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi more isto atque exemplo vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se more et exemplo populi Romani posse iter ulli per provinciam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno exemplo ne omnes vitam viverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istoc exemplo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot me exemplis ludificatust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem exemplo, quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence often of <hi rend="ital">methods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">examples</hi> of punishment (cf. 3. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">quando ego te exemplis pessumis cruciavero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus exemplis crucior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 67</bibl>.—Freq. of the <hi rend="ital">tenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contents</hi> of a letter, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae uno exemplo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the same tenor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere bis eodem exemplo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum duplex ... sed eodem exemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua litterae sunt allatae hoc exemplo: Pompeius mare transiit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(litterarum) exemplum componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exemptilis: <entryFree id="n16797" type="main" key="exempti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemptĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eximo</etym>, <sense id="n16797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be taken out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removable</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">perticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margarita, lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exemptio: <entryFree id="n16798" type="main" key="exempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n16798.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a taking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removing</hi> (not in Cic. or Caes.): <cit><quote lang="la">alvi (apiarii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">favorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cretae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16798.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a detention</hi> of a person summoned before court, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exemptor: <entryFree id="n16799" type="hapax" key="exemptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes out</hi> any thing, esp. <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quarryman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exemptus: <entryFree id="n16800" type="main" key="exemptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from eximo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16801" type="hapax" key="exemptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exemptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>eximo</etym>, <sense id="n16801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneorum (opp. adjectus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exenia: <entryFree id="n16802" type="main" key="exe^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>collat. form of xenia, with <hi rend="ital">e</hi> prosth.; cf. xenium; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 286 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></etym>: <sense id="n16802.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">munera non solum pecunia est, ... non solum exenia sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 25</bibl></cit>; Enarr. 2, 13; P. Diac. Vit. Greg. 24.</sense></entryFree>
exentero: <entryFree id="n16803" type="greek" key="exente^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exentĕro</orth>, v. exintero.</entryFree>
exeo: <entryFree id="n16804" type="main" key="exe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype> (rarely īvi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 50</bibl>; <sense id="n16804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> exit, for exiit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 497</bibl>), ĭtum, īre (<hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> <pb n="683" /> <cb n="EXEO" /> exibo, but exies, exiet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 3:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apocol. 3, 1 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">exiet for exibit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 26 al.</bibl>; perh. also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 65</bibl>; acc. to some MSS. al. evenit; v. Orell. ad h. l.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16804.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16804.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16804.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum intro eo atque exeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ad te exeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe, oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e finibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam ex castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>from one's house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit> (v. ab, I. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab urbe,</quote> <trans><tr>away from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 21, 13, 7; 23, 18, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">al. a villa sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de triclinio, de cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de balneis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cornix) a cauda de ovo,</quote> <trans><tr>tail first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 16, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erant omnino itinera duo, quibus itineribus domo exire possent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>withdraw from</tr>, <tr>leave their country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 29, 1: castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 69, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alias domos tamquam in colonias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in luminis oras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be born</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to go from home to visit a person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">exeat aulā, qui vult esse pius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 493</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exierant dare veris opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:288" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 288</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. or abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de consularibus mea prima sors exisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus nomen exisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi, qui per simulationem ab isto exierant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">61: per septem portus in maris exit aquas (Nilus),</quote> <trans><tr>flows out</tr>, <tr>empties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem aquis (Ister),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:187" default="NO"><author>Val.
