Fl.</author> 8, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo albae folia vetustiora in angulos exeunt,</quote> <trans><tr>terminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 23, 35, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color in florem heliotropii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6, 22, § 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">masculina nomina in A atque S litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>to end</tr>, <tr>terminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti inde exiri possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepuit ostium: exitur foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Velabro, qua in Novam viam exitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 24</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n16804.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16804.5" n="a" level="4"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to move out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, qui de tertia vigilia exissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut paludati (praetores) exeant,</quote> <trans><tr>depart for the battle-field</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Italia ad bellum civile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non posse clam exiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam exitum est maximā copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.6" n="b" level="4"> In jurid. Lat.: potestate, de or a potestate alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to get out of any one's power</hi> (potestas), <hi rend="ital">to be emancipated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become free</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 4, 1, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:62" default="NO">62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:3" default="NO">28, 6, 3</bibl> et saep. (cf. B. 1. infra).—</sense><sense id="n16804.7" n="c" level="4"> De vita, <hi rend="ital">to depart from life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi> (for the usual excedere or decedere de vita): <cit><quote lang="la">quem (me) fuerat aequius ut prius introieram, sic prius exire de vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e vita tamquam e theatro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—</sense><sense id="n16804.8" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To go out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi> in any manner, <hi rend="ital">to issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Isocratis) e ludo tamquam ex equo Trojano meri principes exierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tamen Antonius fugam suam, quia vivus exierat, victoriam vocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">currente rota cur urceus exit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 22</bibl></cit>: libri quidem ita exierunt, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">turned out</hi> (the figure being borrowed from works of art which are cast and turned out of the mould), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.9" n="e" level="4"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque e terra exit hordeum diebus VII.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:45:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne semina in frugem exeant e terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia a radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4, 9, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupinus agro limoso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabae in folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix ulla herba exeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lens sata (with grandescere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, messis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:549" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 549</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.10" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To mount upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">in auras (ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 886</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad caelum (arbor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altitudinem (comae palmarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 8</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXER" /> § 37.—</sense><sense id="n16804.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16804.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exisse ex potestate dicimus eos, qui effrenati feruntur aut libidine aut iracundia, etc. ... Qui igitur exisse ex potestate dicuntur, idcirco dicuntur, quia non sunt in potestate mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque iratos proprie dicimus exisse de potestate, id est de consilio, de ratione, de mente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: a se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 90</bibl></cit>: ex hac aerumna, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 296, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exire aere alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit> (dub. al. se exserere): <cit><quote lang="la">quam nihil non consideratum exibat ex ore!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 265</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequaquam similiter oratio mea exire atque in vulgus emanare poterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:75:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 75, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res prodita est et in vulgus exivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiit opinio, descensurum eum ad Olympia inter athletas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>; for which also with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ante paucos dies exierat in vulgus, laudanti cuidam formam suam, respondisse eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob hoc exivit proverbium, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>became current</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.13" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16804.14" n="a" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to run out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto anno exeunte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutiarum dies exierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies censurae, stipendii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus mihi per otium dies exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16804.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi> beyond a certain measure or limit (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">extra aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra vita, licet supra mille annos exeat,</quote> <trans><tr>run out</tr>, <tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probationes in tertium diem exierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digressus in laudes Castoris ac Pollucis exierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus (translationis usus) in allegorias et aenigmata exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longum exierit ordo rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.16" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus laudabile, numquam a memoria hominum exiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 38</bibl></cit>; so with a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an jam memoriā exisse, neminem ex plebe tribunum militum creatum esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 37, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.17" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose), <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass beyond</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n16804.18" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16804.19" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Avernas valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:698" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum diurni itineris miliariorum numero in reda possit exiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec minor filius lubricum juventae exiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 49</bibl></cit> (55) <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n16804.20" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ward off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore tela atque oculis vigilantibus exit,</quote> <trans><tr>avoids the blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 438</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">feros exibant dentis adactus (jumenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1330</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:802" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 802</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul absiliebat, ut acrem exiret odorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluvium sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 750</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16804.21" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16804.22" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To exceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 632</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16804.23" n="2" level="3"> Of time: ad exitam aetatem = ad ultimam aetatem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=28:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 28, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
exequiae: <entryFree id="n16805" type="main" key="exe^qui^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕquĭae</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exĕquor</orth>, etc., v. exseq-.</entryFree>
exerceo: <entryFree id="n16806" type="main" key="exerce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ercĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, itum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>arceo</etym>, <sense id="n16806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep at work; to oversee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintend;</hi> with an inanimate object, <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ one's self about</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n16806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quod in opere faciundo operae consumis tuae, Si sumas in illis (servis) exercendis, plus agas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines qui agrum colunt, et qui eos exercent praepositive sunt his, quorum in numero sunt vilici et monitores,</quote> <trans><tr>who oversee them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercete, viri, tauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i sane, ego te exercebo hodie, ut dignus es,</quote> <trans><tr>keep agoing</tr>, <tr>exercise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora assiduo varioque exercita motu, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>driven</tr>, <tr>impelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 862</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 120</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">exercita cursu Flumina (with fontes liquidi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 529</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Maeandros) Incertas exercet aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere feras,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive</tr>, <tr>hunt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:62" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Gestiunt pugni mihi. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Si in me exercituru's, quaeso in parietem ut primum domes, <hi rend="ital">to let loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set them at me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus arant Rutulosque exercent vomere colles,</quote> <trans><tr>work</tr>, <tr>till</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum presso sub vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura bubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum in messem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas, arbusta, campos (with curare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum multis arationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguia culta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum vasto in antro (Cyclopes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telas (aranea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:145 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 145 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: neque arva nobis aut <cb n="EXER" /> metalla aut portus sunt, quibus exercendis reservemur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut possint (aratores), sole reducto, Exercere diem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>employ the day in labor</tr>, <tr>perform their day's work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 808</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16806.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To engage busily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi> a person or thing in some action. </sense><sense id="n16806.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in aliqua re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliqua re</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">me adolescentem multos annos in studio ejusdem laudis (Hortensius) exercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod genus belli esse potest, in quo illum non exercuerit fortuna rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Diodoto studiosissime in dialectica exercebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 309</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 244</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (animi vim) tu exerce in optimis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aetas (juvenum) exercenda in labore patientiaque et animi et corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gramineis exercent membra palaestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem et vires in hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 149</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles adolescentes ... ad copiam rhetorum in utramque partem exercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc te amentiam natura peperit, voluntas exercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem dicendi his exercuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium multiplici variaque materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguas litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 375</bibl></cit> et saep.—With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te exercuit Pammenes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Induciomarus copias cogere, exercere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>to exercise</tr>, <tr>drill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis exercendae causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium nostrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 21, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Off. 1, 23, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercendae memoriae gratia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercendi stili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercendus est spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n16806.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> in mid. force; and in <hi rend="ital">part. praes.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exercise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">train one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad hoc unum est natus aut in hoc solo se exercuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vehementissime in his subitis dictionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in consultationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese ad cursuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad velitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese quotidianis commentationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:249" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 71, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se genere pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se genere venationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se saliendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non in utrumque protinus locum se exerceant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem Olympium, eum ipsum, cui se exercebit, implorabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum athletas se exercentes in curriculo videret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: ut exerceamur in venando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in utrumque locum simul exerceamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciunt idem, cum exercentur, athletae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronis pueri amant inter se, discunt, exercentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aliter exerceri velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mandatis tuis exercebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act. part.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, ceteris in campo exercentibus, in herba ipse recubuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ipsique dictata exercentibus darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectavit assidue et exercentes ephebos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ludicra exercendi aut venandi consuetudine adamare solemus,</quote> <trans><tr>of exercising ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>, v. Madv. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n16806.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi> any employment; <hi rend="ital">to employ one's self about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make use of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae exercendae causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc civile quod vocant eatenus exercuerunt, quoad populum praestare voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoricen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:27" default="NO">2, 15, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere atque exigere vectigalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauponam vel stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri, argenti, sulphuris, etc. ... fodinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiationem per libertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:58" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercium turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma contra patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasia et otia et turpes amores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies pueriles,</quote> <trans><tr>batiles in sport</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram et arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:161" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem (with clamare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16806.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry into effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latam legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius exercendas leges esse respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <pb n="684" /> <cb n="EXER" /> legem praecipue sumptuariam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem inter sicarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatem non solum in vivo sed etiam in mortuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">graves inimicitias cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam aut inimicitias in tanta re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia, discordia, simultates cum hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui exercita cum Pisone amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium in aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 275</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitatem et lenitudinem animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris aequabilitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus, libidinem, avaritiam in socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam (juvenes) exercere jubentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foede victoriam in captis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrume victoriam nobilitatis in plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foede et crudeliter victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem et hymenaeos,</quote> <trans><tr>to celebrate</tr>, <tr>solemnize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen patris,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear his name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:21:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 21, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16806.8" n="C" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague</hi> (the figure being taken from the baiting of wild beasts): <cit><quote lang="la">meos casus, in quibus me fortuna vehementer exercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc me reliquiae vestrae exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te nullius exercent numinis irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem odiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 622</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">te de praedio Oviae exerceri, moleste fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo exercentur poenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A, 6, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum vitam curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio animos hominum exercet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates nimio plures et exercuerunt eum et ipse exercuit eas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 9</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nate, Iliacis exercite fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus exercita curis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 779</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curis exercita corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversis probitas exercita rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: habere aliquem exercitum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 6, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭ-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. C.). </sense><sense id="n16806.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harassed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scito nihil tam exercitum esse nunc Romae quam candidatos omnibus iniquitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius tantis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n16806.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Vexatious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid magis sollicitum, magis exercitum dici potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem tam exercitae militiae orabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura hiems, exercita aestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas (with inquieta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantiam pueritiamque habuit laboriosam et exercitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16806.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Disciplined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(miles) exercitatus et vetus ob eam rem fortior (opp. rudis et inexercitatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum in modum juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprio in metu, qui exercitam quoque eloquentiam debilitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omne flagitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium adulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca doctrina ore tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: exercitiorem, exercitissimum (dicebant antiqui), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 8</bibl> Müll. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a practised manner;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 272, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercibilis: <entryFree id="n16807" type="main" key="exerci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exerceo</etym>, <sense id="n16807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">practicable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:3:8:151" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 3, 8, 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercio: <entryFree id="n16808" type="hapax" key="exerci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ex-ser-</orth>), <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>exsarcio</etym>; only trop., <sense id="n16808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make up for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum suom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitamentum: <entryFree id="n16809" type="hapax" key="exerci^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exercito</etym>, <sense id="n16809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 351, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitate: <entryFree id="n16810" type="main" key="exerci^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exercito, <sense id="n16810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exercitatio: <entryFree id="n16811" type="main" key="exerci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exercito</etym>. <sense id="n16811.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting in motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aëris exercitationem (aqua) percolata tempestatibus liquescendo pervenit ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16811.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora nostra motu atque exercitatione recalescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exercitatione ludoque campestri tunicati uteremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis in gymnasiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse incredibili virtute atque exercitatione in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">superiorum pugnarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: usu forensi atque exercitatione tiro, Cic. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:15:47" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 15, 47</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juris civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:de Or. 1:57:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ususque dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Cael. 22:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Brut. 97:331" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Off. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:12" default="NO">2, 17, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: vir <cb n="EXER" /> egregia exercitatione in dialecticis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, rhetoricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:67:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 67, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum opus est, egetque exercitatione non parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic exercitationem virtutis perdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Crotoniensibus nulla virtutis exercitatio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes exercitationesque virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 4, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
exercitator: <entryFree id="n16812" type="main" key="exerci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exerciser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trainer</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">EQVITVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3498 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3413</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitatorius: <entryFree id="n16813" type="main" key="exerci^ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exercitator</etym>, <sense id="n16813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Epist. 26, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitatrix: <entryFree id="n16814" type="hapax" key="exerci^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, that which exercises the body, <sense id="n16814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gymnastics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas partes civilitatis corpori assignet (Plato), medicinam et quam interpretantur exercitatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitatus: <entryFree id="n16815" type="main" key="exerci^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exercito.</entryFree>
exercite: <entryFree id="n16816" type="main" key="exerci^te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exerceo, <sense id="n16816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exercitio: <entryFree id="n16817" type="main" key="exerci^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exerceo</etym>, <sense id="n16817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administration</hi> (anteand post-class., for the class. exercitatio): inertia plus detrimenti facit quam exercitio, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1:section=20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publici judicii exercitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:21:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit> (al. exercitatio): <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:200" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 200</bibl></cit> (al. exsecutio).</sense></entryFree>
exercitium: <entryFree id="n16818" type="main" key="exerci^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exercise</hi> (postAug.; not in Cic. and Caes.): frequentibus exercitiis praeparare milites ad proelia, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliarum quoque rerum vel studio vel exercitio eum teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exercitiis disci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>plays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercito: <entryFree id="n16819" type="main" key="exerci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>exerceo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n16819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exercise diligently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare, but very freq. and class. as <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles ibi se ac suos cursu exercitavisse memoratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus atque ingenium patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. de Rep. Ordin. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. de Rep. Ordin. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet per alia in scholis exercitati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16819.1" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb. disquiet.—Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:76:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 76, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 3.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exer-cĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n16819.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Well exercised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re versatus exercitatusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et in aliis causis exercitatus et in hac multum et saepe versatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in arithmeticis satis exercitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re militari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in propagandis, in regendis finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uxoribus necandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis agitatus et exercitatus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites superioribus proeliis exercitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebis subigendis exercitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi studio exercitata velocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 123</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratiores erunt et tamquam exercitatiores ad bene de multis promerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(an sum) rudis in re publica? quis exercitatior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maritimis rebus exercitatissimi paratissimique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusci ostentorum exercitatissimi interpretes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16819.3" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to exerceo, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Greatly vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tossed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Syrtes exercitatae Noto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex exercitati vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>disquieted</tr>, <tr>troubled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:76:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 76, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sane alias exercitatior magisque in ambiguo Britannia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtāte</orth> (acc. to A.), <hi rend="ital">with practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a practised manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitor: <entryFree id="n16820" type="main" key="exerci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exerceo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n16820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exerciser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trainer</hi> (ante- and post-class.) </sense><sense id="n16820.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic Gurgulio'st exercitor, is hunc hominem cursuram docet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 4</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16820.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who exercises</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practises</hi> any profession, business, calling: <cit><quote lang="la">cauponae aut stabuli,</quote> <trans><tr>an innkeeper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis, ratium,</quote> <trans><tr>a ship-master</tr>, <tr>captain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1" default="NO">4, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 492, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitorius: <entryFree id="n16821" type="main" key="exerci^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exercitor</etym> <cb n="EXFO" /> (post-class.). <sense id="n16821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to exercise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poenit. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16821.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to trade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14</bibl></cit> tit. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitualis: <entryFree id="n16822" type="main" key="exerci^tu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. exercitus</etym>, <sense id="n16822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to an army</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>books of military divination</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exercitus: <entryFree id="n16823" type="main" key="exerci^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exerceo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16824" type="main" key="exerci^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exercĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n16824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> exerciti, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Fragm. 150:311" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Fragm. 150, 311</bibl> (R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:page=155:177" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 155, 177</bibl>); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 16 sq.</bibl> EXERCITVIS, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> ib. 11</bibl>, without example. EXERCITVVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4922</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1 al.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exerceo</etym>. * </sense><sense id="n16824.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro exercitu gymnastico et palaestrico, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16824.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">an exercised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disciplined body of men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an army</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen, acies, phalanx, caterva, manus, legiones): exercitum non unam cohortem neque unam alam dicimus, sed numeros multos militum. Nam exercitui praeesse dicimus eum, qui legionem vel legiones administrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: horrescit telis exercitus asper utrimque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 385, ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:14:13" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 14, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire in exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ab exercitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adesse ad exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e castris educere exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido legiones educere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 63); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum conscribere, comparare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 16, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—As a <hi rend="ital">land army</hi>, in opposition to a naval army or fleet: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem tempore et exercitus ostendebatur et classis intrabat portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42, 2</bibl></cit>. As <hi rend="ital">infantry</hi>, in opposition to cavalry: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) exercitum equitatumque castris continuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 61, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 52, 6</bibl>; cf. Drak. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16824.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16824.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The assembly of the people in the</hi> Centuria Comitiata, as being a military organization, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:9:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 9, § 88</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16824.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">host</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 382</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 824</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:413" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 413</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16824.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">body</hi> of attendants, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic illut dolet, quia remissus est edundi exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissum imperare exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 52.—* </sense><sense id="n16824.7" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to exerceo, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affliction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Noli, obsecro, lacrimis tuis mihi exercitum imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exero: <entryFree id="n16825" type="main" key="exe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exsero.</entryFree>
exerro: <entryFree id="n16826" type="main" key="exerro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-erro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander away</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n16826.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexterque exerrat Arion (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:444" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 444</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 172, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16826.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">err</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a via veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exertus: <entryFree id="n16827" type="main" key="exertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. exsertus under exsero.</entryFree>
exesor: <entryFree id="n16828" type="hapax" key="exe_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exēsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exedo</etym>, <sense id="n16828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which eats away</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">murorum (aestus),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an underminer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:926" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 926</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exesto: <entryFree id="n16829" type="gloss" key="exesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exesto</orth>, extra esto. Sic enim lictor in quibusdam sacris clamitabat: HOSTIS, VINCTVS, MVLIER, VIRGO EXESTO; scilicet interesse prohibebatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
exesus: <entryFree id="n16830" type="main" key="exe_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exedo.</entryFree>
exfibulo: <entryFree id="n16831" type="hapax" key="exfi_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-fībŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unclasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 633</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exfilo: <entryFree id="n16832" type="main" key="exfi_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exfīlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ex-filum</etym>, <sense id="n16832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of threads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unravel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sericum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 38, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exfir: <entryFree id="n16833" type="gloss" key="exfir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exfir</orth>, <itype>purgamentum, unde adhuc manet suffitio</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=79:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 79, 13</bibl> Mull. <sense id="n16833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exfolio: <entryFree id="n16834" type="hapax" key="exfo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-fŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>folium</etym>, <sense id="n16834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strip of leaves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2:section=129" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2, § 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exfornicatus: <entryFree id="n16835" type="main" key="exforni^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-fornĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [-fornicor], <sense id="n16835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having committed fornication</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ep. Jud. 7</bibl>. <pb n="685" /> <cb n="EXHA" /></sense></entryFree>
exfundatus: <entryFree id="n16836" type="hapax" key="exfunda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-fundātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fundus], <sense id="n16836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">razed to the ground</hi>: oppidum, Cael. Antipater ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exfuti: <entryFree id="n16837" type="gloss" key="exfuti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exfuti</orth>, <itype>effusi, ut MERTAT pro mersat</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 10</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n16837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exfututus: <entryFree id="n16838" type="main" key="exfu^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-fŭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [futuo], <sense id="n16838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worn out by debauchery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 13</bibl>; cf. effutuo.</sense></entryFree>
exgurgito: <entryFree id="n16839" type="main" key="exgurgi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-gurgĭto</orth>, v. egurgito.</entryFree>
exhaeresimus: <entryFree id="n16840" type="main" key="exhaeresimus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhaeresimus</orth>, v. exaeresimus.</entryFree>
exhalatio: <entryFree id="n16841" type="main" key="exha_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhālātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exhalo</etym>, <sense id="n16841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exhalation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exhalationes terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhalo: <entryFree id="n16842" type="main" key="exha_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hālo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n16842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evaporate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exhalantque lacus nebulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulam, fumos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caliginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 42, 42, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortiferum spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pruina jam exhalata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: edormi crapulam et exhala, <hi rend="ital">let the fumes pass off</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">get sober</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crapulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores (ara),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam (Aetna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam (i. e. vitam),</quote> <trans><tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 62</bibl></cit>;
