6, 247; 7, 861; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 43: omni bellorum pompa animam exhalare opimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:281" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 281</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremam lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:154" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16842.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16842.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">expire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic illic, ubi mors deprenderat, exhalantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenitur aliquis qui velit perire membratim quam semel exhalare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16842.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to steam</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">vapore altaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhalant vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:108" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhareno: <entryFree id="n16843" type="main" key="exha^re_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hărēno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>harena</etym>, <sense id="n16843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse from sand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 20, § 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhaurio: <entryFree id="n16844" type="main" key="exhauri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-haurĭo</orth>, <itype>hausi, haustum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n16844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part. act.</hi> exhausurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 6</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to empty by drawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exhaust</hi> (class., esp. in the transf. and trop. senses). </sense><sense id="n16844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of liquids: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii malos scandant, alii per foros cursent, alii sentinam exhauriant,</quote> <trans><tr>pump out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to drink up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhausto jam flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 63; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exhaustum poculum,</quote> <trans><tr>emptied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhaustus repente perennis exaruit fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tacent exhausti solibus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:259" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 259</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16844.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things not liquid, <hi rend="ital">to take out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram manibus sagulisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum ligonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex aerario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to empty</tr>, <tr>exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:70:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70, § 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam ex agris urbibusque sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum diripiendum militi dedit: exhaustis deinde tectis ignem injecit,</quote> <trans><tr>completely pillaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 44, 2</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 48</bibl> infra, and Halm ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">exhauriri,</quote> <trans><tr>drained of money impoverished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam sumptibus et jacturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem impensis (aedificandi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios commeatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make bloodless</tr>, <tr>pale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:168" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut exhausta pullulet arca nummus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:363" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 363</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16844.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (according as the notion of taking away or of leaving empty predominates). </sense><sense id="n16844.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libentius omnes meas laudes ad te transfuderim, quam aliquam partem exhauserim ex tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui dolorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi manu vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhausta vis ingens aeris alieni est,</quote> <trans><tr>cleared off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scurra exhausto rubore (i. e. pudore),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad multorum exhaurienda peccata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16844.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To exhaust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to an end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus fuit amor, ut exhauriri nulla posset injuria,</quote> <trans><tr>be exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum benignitas exhausta est in ea re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: unius ambulationis sermone exhaurire (quae sollicitant anguntque), <hi rend="ital">to exhaust in speaking</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to discuss thoroughly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhaustus est sermo hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde exhauriri mea mandata,</quote> <trans><tr>to be accomplished</tr>, <tr>fulfilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXHI" /> 13, 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mandavi omnia, quae quidem tu, ut polliceris, exhauries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <trans><tr>to endure</tr>, <tr>undergo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem, periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 30, 9</bibl></cit> Drak.; 25, 31, 7; 26, 31, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6</bibl>. 236 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastae pericula terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dura et aspera belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenarum exhaustum satis est,</quote> <trans><tr>executed</tr>, <tr>inflicted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhausta nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhaustus cliens,</quote> <trans><tr>worn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhaustus: <entryFree id="n16845" type="main" key="exhaustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhaustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exhaurio.</entryFree>
exherbo: <entryFree id="n16846" type="main" key="exherbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-herbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>herba</etym>, <sense id="n16846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to free from grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:31:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 31, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exheredatio: <entryFree id="n16847" type="main" key="exhe_re_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhērēdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exheredo</etym>, <sense id="n16847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disinheriting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:9:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 9, 1, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exheredator: <entryFree id="n16848" type="main" key="exhe_re_da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhērēdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exheredo</etym>, <sense id="n16848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disinheriter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Amic. 9, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exheredito: <entryFree id="n16849" type="main" key="exhe_re_di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhērēdĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (for the class. exheredo), <sense id="n16849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disinherit</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Contra Avar. 3, p. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exheredo: <entryFree id="n16850" type="main" key="exhe_re_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhērēdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>exheres</etym>, <sense id="n16850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disinherit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16850.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem exheredans te faciebat heredem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 48, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 23, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:20" default="NO">7, 4, 20</bibl>: liberos bonis, Q. Met. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n16850.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive the heir of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mensam ejus exheredaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exheres: <entryFree id="n16851" type="main" key="exhe_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hēres</orth>, <itype>ēdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disinherited.— Subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disinherited person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternorum bonorum exheres filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:42" default="NO">7, 1, 42</bibl> sq. al.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">nive exheredem fecero vitae suae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deprive him of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhibeo: <entryFree id="n16852" type="main" key="exhi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hĭbĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ibeo</orth>, v. Brix. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 37</bibl>), <itype>ŭi, itum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>habeo; lit., to hold out, reach out; hence</etym>, <sense id="n16852.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present; to deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (class.; syn.: praebeo, porrigo, praesto, tribuo, ministro, do, dono, dedo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16852.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ait Praetor: QVEM HOMINEM DOLO MALO RETINES, EXHIBEAS.... Exhibere est in publicum producere, et videndi tangendique hominis facultatem praebere; <cit><quote lang="la">proprie autem exhibere est extra secretum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:29:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 29, 1</bibl></cit> and 3, § 8: jam periculum est ne cogantur ad exhibendum formulam accipere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to acknowledge legal notice</hi>, etc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 50:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 50, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui omnia integra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhibe librarium illud legum vestrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres exhibe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fugitivos apud magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitorem in judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl></cit> quadringentos senatores ad ferrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vias tutas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make safe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to furnish</tr>, <tr>allow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhibuit querulos ore gemente sonos,</quote> <trans><tr>uttered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16852.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16852.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exhibit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhibuit gemino praesignia tempora cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notam linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:526" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 526</bibl></cit>: exhibuit linguam paternam, <hi rend="ital">displayed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">used the language of her father</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 213</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem sucumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malui me tribunum omnibus exhibere quam paucis advocatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ministratorem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se adorandum adeuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl>, where the right reading is praebuit, v. Halm. ad h. l.).—In the latter (reflexive) sense sometimes without se: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me putas populo nostro exhibiturum?</quote> <trans><tr>how I shall exhibit</tr>, <tr>show myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vere civilem virum exhibeat,</quote> <trans><tr>shows</tr>, <tr>proves himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro fratre hostem exhibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16852.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 46:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 46, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16852.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in jurid. Lat.): si quis a liberis ali desideret, vel liberi, ut a parente exhibeantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:33 al" default="NO">3, 5, 33 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythas alimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1" default="NO">22, 1</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n16852.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ; to procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem salvam exhibebo,</quote> <trans><tr>I will set it all right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: quorum virtus exhibet solidum decus, Phaedr. <cb n="EXHO" /> 4, 23, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> Epil. 9: <cit><quote lang="la">munificentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatem, clementiam, comitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatem et justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:33:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem spodii,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to supply the place of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 125</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:6:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to exercise</tr>, <tr>exhibit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>to exercise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui molestiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium hominibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to produce</tr>, <tr>occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui deum nihil habere ipsum negotii (dicunt), nihil exhibere alteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 28, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and once reflexively: jam se exhibebit hic mihi negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>will present itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutias mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilem laborem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 61</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
exhibitio: <entryFree id="n16853" type="main" key="exhi^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhĭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exhibeo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n16853.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A handing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giving up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delivering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabularum testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16853.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to exhibeo, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Sustenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintenance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2:3" default="NO">27, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 6</bibl>, al.</sense></entryFree>
exhibitor: <entryFree id="n16854" type="main" key="exhi^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhĭbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who presents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a giver</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhibitorius: <entryFree id="n16855" type="main" key="exhi^bi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhĭbĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exhibitor</etym>, <sense id="n16855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to handing over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">giving up</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:29:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 29, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhibitus: <entryFree id="n16856" type="main" key="exhi^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exhibeo.</entryFree>
exhilaratio: <entryFree id="n16857" type="main" key="exhi^la^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhĭlărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exhilaro</etym>, <sense id="n16857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gladdening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejoicing</hi> (late Lat.): voluntatis, Aug. de Gen. ad lit. 8, 8.</sense></entryFree>
exhilaro: <entryFree id="n16858" type="main" key="exhi^la^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hĭlăro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gladden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make merry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rejoice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhilarate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16858.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">miraris tam exhilaratam esse servitutem nostram?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:50:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 50, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16858.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ilex, picea, larix, pinus ullo flore exhilarantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are refreshed</tr>, <tr>enlivened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 40, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem hominis frequentiores in cibo lupini exhilarant,</quote> <trans><tr>freshen</tr>, <tr>brighten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 154</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">species mulieris exhilarat faciem viri sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 36, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhinc: <entryFree id="n16859" type="main" key="exhinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hinc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi> (post-class. and very rare, for exinde, exin), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhonoratio: <entryFree id="n16860" type="main" key="exho^no_ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhŏnōrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exhonoro</etym>, <sense id="n16860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dishonoring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 5:18:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 5, 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhonoro: <entryFree id="n16861" type="main" key="exho^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hŏnōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi> (late Lat.): <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 36:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 118:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 118, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 10, 16</bibl>: pauperem, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>, id. Job, 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
exhorreo: <entryFree id="n16862" type="main" key="exhorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-horrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shudder exceedingly at</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be terrified at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dread</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aestus, Col. pöet. 10, 154: mortem sic quisquam exhorruit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:196" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhorresco: <entryFree id="n16863" type="main" key="exhorresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhorresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [exhorreo]. </sense><sense id="n16863.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shudder exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be terrified</hi> (class.): non possum non exhorrescere, si quid intra cutem subest vulneris, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo igitur homines exhorrescunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraque buxo Pallidiora gerens exhorruit aequoris instar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis spiris exhorruit arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:527" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 527</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16863.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shudder at</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be terrified at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dread</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:146" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbere candentes armos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:380" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 380</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 19, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhortatio: <entryFree id="n16864" type="main" key="exhorta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhortātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exhortor</etym>, <sense id="n16864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exhorting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouraging</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.): quae tua exhortatione excepi, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepere cuncta clamoribus et tumultu et exhortatione mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 13, 15 al.</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhortativus: <entryFree id="n16865" type="main" key="exhorta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhortātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to exhortation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortative</hi>: status (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">protreptikh\ parormhtikh\ sta/sis</foreign>), Quint. <pb n="686" /> <cb n="EXIG" /> 3, 6, 47; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> de Diff. 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhortator: <entryFree id="n16866" type="main" key="exhorta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhortātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exhorter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourager</hi> (post-class.): omnium tolerantiarum, Tert. de Fuga in Persec. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exhortatorius: <entryFree id="n16867" type="main" key="exhorta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhortātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exhortator</etym>, <sense id="n16867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hortatory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 209" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhortor: <entryFree id="n16868" type="main" key="exhortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hortor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n16868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhortavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76, 10</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhortantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhortatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Soc. 1, 7</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n16868.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidosque obitumque timentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 152</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidos cives in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros in illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in ambos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:685" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 472</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeco sermone ad spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ad ultionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 241</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14</bibl>; cf. with simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes nostros exhortatus es, consulatum circumirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:69:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 69, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semetipsos hortantur vel aliquas partes earum addiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alloquendo exhortandoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16868.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes exhortabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parsimoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec exhortare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exhumoro: <entryFree id="n16869" type="hapax" key="exhu_mo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-hūmōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>humor</etym>, <sense id="n16869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to free from</hi> (injurious) <hi rend="ital">humors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exhydriae: <entryFree id="n16870" type="greek" key="exhy_^dri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exhȳ^drĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (venti) = <foreign lang="greek">e)cudri/ai a)/nemoi</foreign>, <sense id="n16870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winds accompanied by rain</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 62, 3.</sense></entryFree>
exibilo: <entryFree id="n16871" type="main" key="exi_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exībĭlo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exicco</orth>, v. exsib-, exsicc-.</entryFree>
exignesco: <entryFree id="n16872" type="hapax" key="exignesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ignesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n16872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become ignited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn to fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus tum exignescere, tum exaquescere videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exigo: <entryFree id="n16873" type="main" key="exi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>, <sense id="n16873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16873.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16873.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">reges ex civitate,</quote> <trans><tr>to expel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem e campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 8</bibl></cit>: exigor patria, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 291, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 41, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adcolas ultra famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exacti reges,</quote> <trans><tr>driven away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinio exacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno post Tarquinios exactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orestes exactus furiis,</quote> <trans><tr>driven</tr>, <tr>tormented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:70" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put away</tr>, <tr>divorce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; cf.: illam suam (uxorem) suas res sibi habere jussit ex duodecim tabulis; claves ademit; <cit><quote lang="la">exegit,</quote> <trans><tr>turned her out of the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>: aliquem vitā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, Sen. de Ira, 1, 6: corpus e stratis, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:234" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 234</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculam,</quote> <trans><tr>to take out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: et sacer admissas exigit Hebrus aquas, <hi rend="ital">pours</hi> out <hi rend="ital">into the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 114</bibl>; of weapons, <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> from one, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non circumspectis exactum viribus ensem Fregit,</quote> <trans><tr>thrust</tr>, <tr>impelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 171</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 656</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem per medium juvenem,</quote> <trans><tr>plunges through the middle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 815</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium per viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:68" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: aliquem hastā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to thrust through</tr>, <tr>transfix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:572" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 572</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (hasta) cervice exacta est,</quote> <trans><tr>passed out</tr>, <tr>passed through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 138</bibl></cit>: prope sub conatu adversarii manus exigenda, <hi rend="ital">to be put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raised</hi> (for a blow), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">(capellas) a grege in campos, hircos in caprilia,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues pastum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices altius,</quote> <trans><tr>to send out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:2" default="NO">3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n16873.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16873.4" n="1" level="3"> A scenic t. t., <hi rend="ital">to drive off</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hiss off</hi> a piece or a player from the stage (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">spectandae (fabulae) an exigendae sint vobis prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 27</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so, fabulas, id. Hec. prol. alt. 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enforce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi> payment of a debt, taxes, etc., or the performance of any other duty (very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: posco, postulo, flagito, contendo, etc.): ad eas pecunias exigendas legatos misimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: pecunias a civitatibus, id. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:10:33" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbissime pecunias imperatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXIG" /> 32; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaternos denarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum peditumque certum numerum a civitatibus Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides ab Apolloniatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <trans><tr>to demand the construction of a road</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quoquam ne pejeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 36</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: rationem, <hi rend="ital">to exact an account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Athenienses rationibus exigendis non vacarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 81, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertorum nomina a quibus ratio exigi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16873.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: exigor aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to be solicited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dunned</hi> for money, etc. (post-class.): exigor portorium, id est, exigitur de me portorium, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 14, 5</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 24</bibl>: (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 51</bibl>): sese pecunias maximas exactos esse, Q. Metell. Numid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 4, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire into</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec illae (conjuges) numerare aut exigere plagas pavent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (so Ritter, Halm, with all MSS., cf. Holzmann ad loc.; al. exugere, said to have been the read. of a lost codex, the Arundelianus; cf. exsugo); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exactum et a Titidio Labeone, cur omisisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.8" n="4" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave behind</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cum primus equis exegit anhelis Phoebus Athon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:75" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 11</bibl> (4, 20, 3 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">Troglodytae hibernum mare exigunt circa brumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.9" n="5" level="3"> In mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to dispose of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum exigere fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9, 9</bibl></cit> Drak.: mercibus exactis, Col. poët. 10, 317. —</sense><sense id="n16873.10" n="6" level="3"> Mathemat. t. t., to apply to a standard or measure, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi> by any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perpendiculum columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam ad regulam et libellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus margaritarum sua manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16873.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16873.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">locus, Ubi labore lassitudo exigunda ex corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: frigus atque horrorem vestimentis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 291, 8</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n16873.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16873.14" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claim</hi> any thing due: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero et exspectabo ea quae polliceris, neque exigam, nisi tuo commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid exigere magis quam rogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiores litteras exspectabo vel potius exigam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ex rebus voluptatem quasi mercedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc acerbius exegit natura quod dederat,</quote> <trans><tr>demanded back</tr>, <tr>reclaimed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl></cit> Klotz.: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut a poëta, sed ut a teste veritatem exigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has toties optata exegit gloria poenas,</quote> <trans><tr>has cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas,</quote> <trans><tr>to take vengeance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vulnere poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 478</bibl></cit>: poenam (alicui), Sen. de Ira, 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:230" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravia piacula ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 18</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigerem ex te cogeremque, ut responderes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28, 80</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Calypso exigit fata ducis,</quote> <trans><tr>questions</tr>, <tr>inquires into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactum a marito, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigite ut mores seu pollice ducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:237 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 237 sq.</bibl></cit>—With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigimus potuisse eum eo tempore testamentum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:2" default="NO">24, 3, 2</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exigendo non acerbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res exiget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:3" default="NO">10, 3, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res exiget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si communis utilitas exegerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.— Esp.: rationem, <hi rend="ital">to require an account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid rationem exiges, cum tibi aliquis hos dixerit versus?</quote> <trans><tr>an explanation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 19, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.15" n="2" level="3"> Of time, life, etc., <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non novisse quicum aetatem exegerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te dignam mala malam aetatem exigas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: vitam taetre, Cat. Or. inc. 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maerore graviorem vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:85:49" default="NO" valid="yes">85, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:4 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl>, ext. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ad pariendum temporibus exactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>: qui exacta aetate moriuntur, <hi rend="ital">at the</hi> <cb n="EXIG" /> <hi rend="ital">close of the vigorous period of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam dies exegerat horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 777</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 209</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristissimam noctem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem supremum noctemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullum tempus jucundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam aestatem exactam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per exactos annos,</quote> <trans><tr>at the end of every year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exacto per scelera die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exacto quadriennio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.16" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.17" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">exegi monumentum aere perennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 811</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 871</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactus tenui pumice versus eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 637</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarii ita sunt exacti, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem gracilitatem stilo exigere condiscant,</quote> <trans><tr>to reach</tr>, <tr>attain to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.18" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociisque exacta referre,</quote> <trans><tr>his discoveries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prius exacta tenui ratione saporum,</quote> <trans><tr>before he has ascertained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen exactum, quid agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 637</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Am, 3, 7, 16. —</sense><sense id="n16873.19" n="6" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, = examinare, ponderare (class. but perh. not in Cic.): si ad illam summam veritatem legitimum jus exegeris, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>; cf.: nolite ad vestras leges atque instituta exigere ea, quae Lacedaemone fiunt, <hi rend="ital">to estimate by the standard of</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31, 17</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opus ad vires suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnia argumenta ad obrussam coeperimus exigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">principatus tuus ad obrussam exigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Clem. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Clem. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regulam emendate loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa non nisi aure exiguntur, quae fiunt per sonos,</quote> <trans><tr>are judged of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.20" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate</hi> respecting something, = considerare, deliberare (class. but not in Cic.): de his rebus ut exigeret cum eo, Furnio mandavi, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secum aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 587</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliqua re coram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec exigentes hostes oppressere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicendum, quid tacendum, quid differendum sit, exigere consilii est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16873.21" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 5., measured; hence), <hi rend="ital">precise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi> (poet and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">difficile est, quot ceciderint, exacto affirmare numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies falcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 42, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 9, 46</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:87:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 87, 4</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 89" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamurius, morum fabraene exactior artis, Difficile est dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:383" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 383</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exacte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exacte perorantibus mos est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: dicere, disserere, Mel. Prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exigue: <entryFree id="n16874" type="main" key="exi^gu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparingly</hi>, v. exiguus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exiguitas: <entryFree id="n16875" type="main" key="exi^gu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exiguus</etym>, <sense id="n16875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scantiness</hi> in measure or number, <hi rend="ital">smallness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">littleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16875.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paucitatem militum ex castrorum exiguitate cognoscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque in quibus (voluptatibus) propter earum exiguitatem obscuratio consequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: copiarum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the follg.: congiariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis tanta fuit exiguitas, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 17, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16875.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Crassus animadvertit, suas copias propter exiguitatem non facile diduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exiguus: <entryFree id="n16876" type="main" key="exi^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exigo, II.
