B. 5.; cf. contiguus, from contingo; lit., weighed, exact; hence opp. to abundant, beyond measure; cf.: parvus, pusillus, minutus</etym>, <sense id="n16876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scanty</hi> in measure or number, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16876.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (freq. <pb n="687" /> <cb n="EXIL" /> and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exile et exiguum et vietum cor et dissimile cordis fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me corporis exigui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem ex immenso campo in exiguum sane gyrum compellitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam exiguis quibusdam finibus totum oratoris munus circumdedisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 62, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteram partem nimis exiguam atque angustam esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae exiguam significationem tuae erga me voluntatis habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">exigua et infirma civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">torques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 77</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus oratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae amicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum particula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:301" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">census,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars unius anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars aestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandis aut exigua (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: abundans corporis exiguusque animi, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 381</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua exiguior facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 32" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cytisum aridum si dabis, exiguius dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars exiguissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16876.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n16876.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi> (post-Aug.).—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum campi ante castra erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum spatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:248" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum de naturae patriaeque veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 123</bibl></cit>: exiguo (sc. tempore) post obitum ipsius, <hi rend="ital">a short time after</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam exiguum sapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res hodie minor est here quam fuit, atque eadem cras Deteret exiguis aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:23 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 23 sq.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n16876.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poor man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguo conceditur misericordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly; slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scantily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparingly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16876.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem est nimis exigue et exiliter ad calculos revocare amicitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>too narrowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigue sumptum praebent (parentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione inita frumentum se exigue dierum XXX. habere,</quote> <trans><tr>hardly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter exigueque dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>slightly</tr>, <tr>briefly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola exigue scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigue atque frigide laudari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: Vergilius hunc Homeri versum exigue secutus est, <hi rend="ital">to a slight degree</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not closely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16876.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭum</orth> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dormire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 77, 97, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tument vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 431</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16876.7" n="(g)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭgŭo</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 240" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 240</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exilica: <entryFree id="n16877" type="gloss" key="exi^li^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭlĭca</orth> <itype>causa, quae adversus exsulem agitur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 5</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
exilio: <entryFree id="n16878" type="main" key="exi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. exsilio.</entryFree>
exilis: <entryFree id="n16879" type="main" key="exi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex and ile, ilia; hence, without entrails, i. e. thin, lank, Corss. Ausspr. 2, 1003</etym>, <sense id="n16879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: tenuis, gracilis, macer): exile et exiguum et vietum cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur horridum et exile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur (opp. tumentes surae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod solum tam exile et macrum est, quod, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>thin</tr>, <tr>poor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Arisbe glebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilis domus est, ubi non et multa supersunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>poor</tr>, <tr>wretched</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Plutonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cheerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus plena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas (with parva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:86" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16879.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16879.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inadequate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sermonis exile, aridum, concisum ac minutum,</quote> <trans><tr>meagre</tr>, <tr>dry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of speech,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 315</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl> (opp. tumida);<cb n="EXIM" />  cf. of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">pro pressis exiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (opp. plena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentis admodum exilibus niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16879.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilis atque inanis aegritudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro prunorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox feminis quam maribus (opp. gravior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 269</bibl></cit>: vox in senecta, ib. § 270.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">thinly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagrely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dryly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo verba exiliter exanimata exire,</quote> <trans><tr>feebly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales sane exiliter scripti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputare (with jejune),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilius dicere de aliqua re,</quote> <trans><tr>more sparingly</tr>, <tr>briefly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 2</bibl></cit> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
exilitas: <entryFree id="n16880" type="main" key="exi_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exilis</etym>, <sense id="n16880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thinness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagreness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poorness</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aculei apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19, 118, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:18:16:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 18, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineae vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarundam litterarum (opp. pinguitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n16880.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of speech, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo (opp. ubertatem et copiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exiliter: <entryFree id="n16881" type="main" key="exi_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exilis <sense id="n16881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exilium: <entryFree id="n16882" type="main" key="exi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. exsilium.</entryFree>
exim: <entryFree id="n16883" type="main" key="exim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exim</orth>, v. exinde <sense id="n16883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eximie: <entryFree id="n16884" type="main" key="exi^mi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭmĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. eximius <sense id="n16884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eximietas: <entryFree id="n16885" type="main" key="exi^mi^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭmĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eximius</etym>, <sense id="n16885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminence</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 32:231" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 32, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:237" default="NO">237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eximius: <entryFree id="n16886" type="main" key="exi^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eximo</etym>. <sense id="n16886.0" n="I" level="1"> Taken out from the mass, i. e. <hi rend="ital">excepted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exempt</hi> (rare but class. = exemptus, exceptus): <cit><quote lang="la">eximium neminem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: neque esset veri simile, cum omnibus Siculis faceret injurias, te illi unum eximium, cui consuleret, fuisse, <hi rend="ital">you should be the only excepted one</hi>, Cic. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:16:52" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 16, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu unus eximius es, in quo hoc praecipuum valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 11</bibl></cit>.— Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n16886.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncommon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">egregius, praeclarus, divinus, lautus, magnificus): ea quae eximia plerisque et praeclara videntur, parva ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa semper in te eximia et praestantia fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompei singularis eximiaque virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier facie eximia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudine eximia femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximii forma pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximii praestanti corpore tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 538</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria virtutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo e collegio laus est illa eximia C. Julii, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba eximii usus ad vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 95, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes Aetnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 594</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">partitive gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximii regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximius animam servare sub undis,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly</tr>, <tr>skilful</tr>, <tr>expert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 697</bibl></cit>.—Hence <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭmĭe</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncommonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">egregie, unice): C. Marius L. Plocium eximie dilexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximie et unice delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e. atque verissime opinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polliceri omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 104, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatum templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum stagnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eximo: <entryFree id="n16887" type="main" key="exi^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ĭmo</orth>, <itype>ēmi, emptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>emo; cf. adimo and demo</etym>, <sense id="n16887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (class.; syn.: demo, adimo, eripio, furor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16887.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16887.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, or simple <case>abl.</case>; rare with <case>dat.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">eximito (acina) de dolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:112:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 112, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas, ulmos bene cum radicibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medullam e caule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 71, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 181</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lienem cani viventi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 6, 17, § 51</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">lapillos ventre crocodili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te exempta juvat spinis de pluribus una?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximi jubet non diem ex mense, sed ex anno unum mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu ex reis eximerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>, § 99; for which: aliquem de reis, <cb n="EXIN" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 19</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">41: cf.: ut auctores alios omnino exemerint numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with which cf.: Phraaten numero beatorum Eximit virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui turbae quamvis bonorum auctorum eximatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16887.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum tamquam e vinculis eximamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ex obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliquos (urbem) obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi circumsessus adventu fratris obsidione eximitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 41, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n16887.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16887.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si exemeris ex rerum natura benevolentiae conjunctionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui lassitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod me angebat, non eximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dies vere mihi festus atras Eximet curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus sollicitis animis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam religionem (augures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitationem hujus utilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam res adversae consilium eximerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemptā fine patere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:976" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 976</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1007" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1007</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: plurimis mortalium non eximitur, quin primo cujusque ortu ventura destinentur, <hi rend="ital">the idea is not taken from them</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">they cannot be convinced but that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16887.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16887.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi> from any thing; constr. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, the <case>abl.</case>, since the Aug. per. freq. with <case>dat.</case>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me exemisti Philocratem fallaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iis (rationibus) accusator ad alios ex culpa eximendos abutetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex miseriis plurimis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex servitute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui servitute exempti fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives servitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non noxae (al. noxa) eximitur C. Fabius, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35, 5</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicio magis quam crimini exemptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sceleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:256" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones adversae pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonem ignominiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut morte honesta contumeliis captivitatis eximeretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae jam destinatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:22:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 22, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionibus vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">exime hunc mihi scrupulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">6, 8, 7: Romanis dubitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de proscriptorum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum de vectigalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to exempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sorte (opus fuisse) nisi quod se quisque eximi voluerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16887.8" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius rogatus diem dicendo eximere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus calumnia dicendi tempus exemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno exempto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horam eximere ullam in tali cive liberando sine scelere non possumus,</quote> <trans><tr>lose</tr>, <tr>waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit> B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n16887.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To except</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave out</hi> of consideration: <cit><quote lang="la">leges, si majestatis quaestio eximeretur, bono in usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16887.10" n="4" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent from appearing in court</hi>: eum qui in jus vocatur, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exin: <entryFree id="n16888" type="main" key="exin"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exin</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exinde.</entryFree>
exinanio: <entryFree id="n16889" type="main" key="exi^na_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ĭnānĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make empty</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam provinciam C. Verres per triennium depopulatus esse, Siculorum civitates vastasse, domos exinanisse, fana spoliasse dicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>to make desolate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros (with vastare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>, § 64; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, § 104</bibl>: castra, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 107, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regibus atque omnibus gentibus exinanitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. also: ama rem tuam: hunc (amatorem) exinani, <hi rend="ital">clean out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">strip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium suum donationibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to consume</tr>, <tr>waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:89" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes relinquunt exinanitas alvos,</quote> <trans><tr>emptied</tr>, <tr>empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onusta vehicula,</quote> <trans><tr>to unload</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum, bilem, pituitam,</quote> <trans><tr>to void</tr>, <tr>discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 36, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lienem,</quote> <trans><tr>to consume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 20, § 45</bibl></cit>: <pb n="688" /> <cb n="EXIN" /> hydropicos, <hi rend="ital">to tap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 35, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplici partu exinanitur ubertas,</quote> <trans><tr>is exhausted</tr>, <tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 22, 51, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex non est exinanita,</quote> <trans><tr>drained out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:74:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 74, 9</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exinanita est fides,</quote> <trans><tr>made powerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet ipsum exinanivit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>laid aside his glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Philip. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exinanite,</quote> <trans><tr>destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:136:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 136, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exinanitio: <entryFree id="n16890" type="main" key="exi^na_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭnānītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exinanio</etym>, <sense id="n16890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emptying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evacuation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florescendi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an exhausting</tr>, <tr>enfeebling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exinde: <entryFree id="n16891" type="main" key="exinde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-indē</orth>, and apocopated <orth extent="full" lang="la">exin</orth> (like dein, proin, from deinde, proinde; cf. <sense id="n16891.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">also: dein etiam saepe et exin pro deinde et exinde dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl></cit>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exim</orth>, <itype>like him, illim</itype>, istim; acc. to the best MSS. in Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 341</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48 al.</bibl>; M. Aurel. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, p. 54" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, p. 54</bibl>; cf. exsim, <foreign lang="greek">eu)qe/ws</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 148</bibl>; Wagn. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 341</bibl>, and tom. 5, p. 437; v. Ritschl, Rhein. Mus. 7, 472 sqq.; Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 218</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">from there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thence</hi> (freq., but not in Ter., Caes., or Quint.). </sense><sense id="n16891.1" n="I" level="1"> In space (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): utcumque in alto ventus est, Epidice, exin velum vortitur,</quote> <trans><tr>from there</tr>, <tr>thence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si servus cujusquam in ecclesiam altariave armatus ... irruerit, exinde protinus abstrahatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem Commagenam, exim Cappadociam, inde Armenios petivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16891.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in (local) succession, <hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at vero quanta maris est pulchritudo! ... exin mari finitimus aër, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: hinc Equus summum contingit caput alvo ... exin contortis Aries cum cornibus haeret, id. poët. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 43, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliares Galli Germanique in fronte, post quos pedites sagittarii, dein quatuor legiones ... exin totidem aliae legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16891.3" n="II" level="1"> In time, <hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>: exin compellare pater me voce videtur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 45, ed. Vahl.): POPULI PARTES IN TRIBUS DISTRIBUUNTO; <cit><quote lang="la">EXIN PECUNIAS, AEVITATES, ORDINES PARTIUNTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exin cuidam rustico Romano dormienti visus est venire qui diceret, etc. ... exin filium ejus esse mortuum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: quisque suos patimur Manes; <cit><quote lang="la">exinde per amplum Mittimur Elysium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Mundam exinde castra Punica mota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16891.4" n="b" level="4"> After <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi> or <hi rend="ital">postquam</hi> (cf. deinde, II. d.): <cit><quote lang="la">ostium ubi conspexi, exinde me ilico protinam dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam alium repperit... me exinde amovit loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16891.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16891.6" n="1" level="3"> In an enumeration or succession of events, <hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furthermore</hi> (cf. deinde, II. A. b.): pone petunt, exim referunt ad pectora tonsas, Enn. s. v. tonsam, p. 356 Müll. (Ann. v. 236, ed. Vahl.): incenditque animum famae venientis amore; <cit><quote lang="la">Exin bella viro memorat, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exin se cuncti divinis rebus ad urbem Perfectis referunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 47, 8</bibl>; 40, 35, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 9, 8: Suillio corruptionem militum ... exin adulterium Poppaeae, ac postremum mollitiam corporis objectante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16891.7" n="2" level="3"> In late Lat., i. q. ex illo tempore, <hi rend="ital">from that time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem morem vestis exinde gens universa tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum post motam et omissam quaestionem res ad nova dominia bona fide transierint, et exinde novi viginti anni intercesserint, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:6:4" default="NO">41, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:12" default="NO">49, 15, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex quo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exinde, ut curiam participare coepi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exinde ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, p. 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exinde cum ex astu a magistro digressi sumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 113: <cit><quote lang="la">videri legatum habere jurisdictionem non exinde, ex quo mandata est, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:67" default="NO">5, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16891.8" n="III" level="1"> In other relations, in which a going out or forth takes place. </sense><sense id="n16891.9" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to ex, III. E.) To indicate the origin or occasion of an event (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">thence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam idonei lucri exinde cepimus, sed vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 35</bibl>: quodcumque exinde incommodum ecclesiae<cb n="EXIS" />  contigerit, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16891.10" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to ex, III. H.) To indicate a rule, measure, or standard, <hi rend="ital">hence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi> (anteclass.): proinde ut quisque fortuna utitur, ita praecellet; <cit><quote lang="la">atque exinde sapere eum omnes dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fama 'st homini, exin solet pecuniam invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad molas alii asellis, alii vaccis ac mulis utuntur, exinde ut pabuli facultas est,</quote> <trans><tr>according as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exinfulabat: <entryFree id="n16892" type="gloss" key="exinfulabat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exinfulabat</orth> = exserebat: infulas enim sacerdotum filamenta vocabant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 18</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
exintero: <entryFree id="n16893" type="greek" key="exinte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exintĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exen-, exten-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)centerizw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n16893.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to disembowel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 14, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 10, 27, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 8, 29, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exinteratus lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (exentera hunc piscem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 6, 5</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">aves per guttur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:section=236" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, § 236</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16893.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">to torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectando exedor miser atque exinteror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16893.2" n="III" level="1"> Com. meton., <hi rend="ital">to empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">marsupium alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes argentarias mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
existimabilis: <entryFree id="n16894" type="main" key="existi^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">existĭmābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>existimo</etym>, <sense id="n16894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supposable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likely</hi> (late Latin), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:35" default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:17" default="NO">3, 17</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
existimatio: <entryFree id="n16895" type="main" key="existi^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">existĭmātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">existum-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposition</hi> (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> equally common). </sense><sense id="n16895.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">re et existimatione jam, lege et pronuntiatione nondum condemnato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 56</bibl></cit>. non est tibi his solis utendum existimationibus ac judiciis, qui nunc sunt, hominum, sed, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de pietate dixistis, est quidem ista vestra existimatio, sed judicium certe parentis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that is your opinion</tr>, <tr>but the father is the proper judge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne respexeris clandestinas existimationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc genere facilior est existimatio quam reprehensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitorum existimatione reprehendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">militis de imperatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41, 2</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">communis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illum ante tibi satis facere, quam tu omnium existimationi satis fecisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 133</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir optimus omnium existimatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16895.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, objectively (cf. rumor, B.), <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimatio est dignitatis illaesae status, legibus ac moribus comprobatus, qui ex delicto nostro auctoritate legum aut minuitur aut consumitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil eum fecisse scientem, quod esset contra aut rem aut existimationem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo egens, sordidus, sine honore, sine existimatione, sine censu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 22, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo fortunā egens, vitā turpis, existimatione damnatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia summae existimationis et paene dicam capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid existimas in ea re violari existimationem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationem offendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationi alicujus consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad debitorum tuendam existimationem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>credit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
existimator: <entryFree id="n16896" type="main" key="existi^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">existĭmātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">existŭm-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judge</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">a critic</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut existimatores videamur loqui, non magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus et intellegens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 320</bibl></cit>; cf.: intellegens dicendi. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultus alieni artificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimator metuendus (opp. admirandus orator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
existimo: <entryFree id="n16897" type="main" key="existi^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-istĭmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">existŭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>aestimo</etym>. <sense id="n16897.0" n="I" level="1"> = aestimo, <hi rend="ital">to value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of value (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">satin abiit neque quod dixi flocci existumat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ne ob malefacta peream, parvi existumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: omnia minoris, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minoris aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">interrog. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc si dico ut res est, quem ad modum existumet me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit> Ritschl. <cb n="EXIT" /> —</sense><sense id="n16897.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem.</hi>—Constr. with the <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16897.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: si improbum Cresphontem existimaveras, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 156, ed. Vahl., where the reading is existimas); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eum, qui hoc facit, avarum possumus existimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82, § 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego nullo modo existimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidianae vitae consuetudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>pass judgment upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Fulcinius domi suae honestus existimatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Cornelius, homo, ut existimabatur, avarus et furax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (fama) diu princeps oratorum ... existimandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularitas signum affectati regni est existimatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assimulata sunt schemata existimanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: utcunque (haec) animadversa aut existimata erunt, Liv. praef. § 8.—</sense><sense id="n16897.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">object</hi> (so most freq.): tu me amas, ego te amo; <cit><quote lang="la">merito id fieri uterque existimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id quidem me dignum esse existimat, Quem adeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si majores nostri existimavissent, quemquam Rulli similem futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum existimare, plus quemquam a se ipso quam me a te amari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic existimo, hos oratores fuisse maximos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36, 138</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with an <hi rend="ital">inf. clause</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit hoc in utroque eorum, ut Crassus non tam existimari vellet non didicisse, quam illa despicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina in Britannia reperta, atque inde in Galliam translata esse existimatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistocles suasisse existimatur Atheniensibus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 92</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (insulae) milia DCCC. in longitudinem esse existimatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16897.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud existimans, quanto labore partum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vos existimate, facta an dicta pluris sint,</quote> <trans><tr>judge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 14</bibl></cit> Cort.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum avertendae suspicionis causa, etc., an, etc., existimari non poterat,</quote> <trans><tr>be judged</tr>, <tr>decided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pyrrhus) utrum avarior an crudelior sit, vix existimari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimari a medicis jubet, an talis caecitas ac debilitas superabiles forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16897.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de scriptoribus, qui nondum ediderunt, existimare non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eventu homines de tuo consilio existimaturos videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male de aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a bad opinion of any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ipse quem ad modum existimes vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstant orationes, ex quibus existimari de ingeniis eorum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostium numero existimari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be regarded as an enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Cicero existimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut multi existimarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita intellegimus vulgo existimari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">existĭmantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">critics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">critical judges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in existimantium arbitrium sua scripta non venerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
existo: <entryFree id="n16898" type="main" key="existo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">existo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exsisto.</entryFree>
exitiabilis: <entryFree id="n16899" type="main" key="exi^ti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exitium</etym>, <sense id="n16899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exitiabilem illi faciam diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: bellum suis civibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus in suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 44</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭā-bĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">perniciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
