exitialis: <entryFree id="n16900" type="main" key="exi^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi> (rare but class.): exitus exitiales habere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia venenata magis exitialia, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 72, 93, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminosum et exitiale habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">perniciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exitio: <entryFree id="n16901" type="main" key="exi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exeo</etym>, <sense id="n16901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coming out</hi> (ante-class. and late Lat.): ex utero, <pb n="689" /> <cb n="EXIT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 30</bibl>: a Deo, Hilar. Trin. 6, 31.</sense></entryFree>
exitiose: <entryFree id="n16902" type="main" key="exi^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exitiosus <sense id="n16902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exitiosus: <entryFree id="n16903" type="main" key="exi^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exitium</etym>, <sense id="n16903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pernicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus a servis caedem fieri senatus et bonorum rei publicae exitiosum fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 36, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod exitiosum fore, si evenisset, videbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of persons (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Otho luxu, saevitia, audacia reipublicae exitiosior ducebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 34</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ĭtĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">perniciously.—Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exitium: <entryFree id="n16904" type="main" key="exi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n16904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> exitium, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 67</bibl>, and Or. 46, 155), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exeo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n16904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">egress</hi> (ante-class.): exitium antiqui ponebant pro exitu; nunc exitium pessimum exitum dicimus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81, 6</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illi ex utero exitiost, priusquam poterat ire in proelium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 30</bibl></cit> (but for exitium exitio est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 4</bibl>, the true reading is auxilium mist, etc., Fleck. Lorenz). —</sense><sense id="n16904.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mischief</hi> (freq. and class., <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; syn.: pernicies, interitus, ruina, infortunium, casus, clades, calamitas, malum). </sense><sense id="n16904.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satius est mihi Quovis exitio interire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pultando foribus exitium adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de meo nostrumque omnium interitu, qui de hujus urbis atque adeo orbis terrarum exitio cogitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: (Lentulus) dignum moribus factisque suis exitium vitae invenit,</quote> <trans><tr>end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius patitur natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 224</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli terraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:344" default="NO" valid="yes">344</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de pernicie populi Romani, exitio hujus urbis tam acerbe tamque crudeliter cogitarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miserum! ego omnibus meis exitio fuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitio esse (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque adeo flagitatus est, donec ad exitium dederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidit auguris Argivi domus ob lucrum Demersa exitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16904.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: omnibus exitiis interii, <hi rend="ital">ways</hi> or <hi rend="ital">methods</hi> of destruction, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum afflictarum perditis jam rebus extremi exitiorum exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:809" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 809</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitiūm examen rapit, Enn. l. l. (Trag. v. 88, ed. Vahl.): quos P. Clodii furor rapinis et incendiis et omnibus exitiis pavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu crudelissimorum exitiorum carere non possumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id querebatur caput esse exitiorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res suprema manebat Exitiis positura modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exitus: <entryFree id="n16905" type="main" key="exi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exeo, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16906" type="main" key="exi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exeo</etym>, <sense id="n16906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">egress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n16906.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum mihi gloriosum injuria tua dedit, non exitum calamitosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni exitu et pabulatione interclusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum sibi parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum hominum occultos exitus asservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25, 4</bibl>. —Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">introitusque elementis redditus exstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus ut classi felix faustusque daretur,</quote> <trans><tr>a setting sail</tr>, <tr>departure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <trans><tr>a flowing out</tr>, <tr>discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 727</bibl></cit>: animaï (i. e. venti), <hi rend="ital">a bursting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rushing out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 586</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16906.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">way of egress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum non habent, ac pervium non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=145" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 145</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum angusto portarum exitu se ipsi premerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exitu paludis,</quote> <trans><tr>mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <trans><tr>vent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 34, 40, § 116</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si de multis nullus placet exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula undique exitus maritimos habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:75:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem exitus e domo fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 48, § 82</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n16906.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16906.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">termination</hi> (syn.: eventus, eventum). </sense><sense id="n16906.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus orationis difficilius est exitum quam principium invenire,</quote> <trans><tr>end</tr>, <tr>close</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: quemadmodum expediam exitum hujus institutae orationis, non reperio, id. <cb n="EXOB" /> Fam. 3, 12, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus fuit orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tragici poëtae, cum explicare argumenti exitum non potestis, confugitis ad deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducta ad exitum quaestio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exitum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita magnarum initia rerum celerem et facilem exitum habuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba quae casus habent in exitu similes,</quote> <trans><tr>at the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll.: fugam quaerebamus omnes, quae ipsa exitum non habebat,</quote> <trans><tr>end</tr>, <tr>aim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc omne principium, huc refer exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in exitu est meus consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: in exitu jam annus erat <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimi, fabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>the catastrophe</tr>, <tr>conclusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>end of life</tr>, <tr>latter end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae mortisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes exitus habuit consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>: eae causae sunt plenissimae, quae plurimos exitus dant ad ejusmodi degressionem, <hi rend="ital">outlets</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">opportunities</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 312</bibl>: habent exitus aut in <hi rend="ital">a</hi> aut in <hi rend="ital">e</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 62</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n16906.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">end of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura ad humanum exitum (Romulum) abripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duravere usque ad Sejani exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 74, § 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus in dubio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thrasymachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:204" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevus et illum exitus eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:271" default="NO">271</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam bonos exitus habent boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur fatales exitus habuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16906.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">method</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">device</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solution</hi> of a difficulty: <cit><quote lang="la">cum autem exitus ab utroque datur conturbato errantique regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum viam quaestus invenerunt, verum etiam exitum ac rationem defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nullum fortunis communibus exitum reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:47:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16906.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">event</hi>, i. q. eventus: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi alterutrum de eventu atque exitu rerum promittendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum exitum spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur ad exitum venisse quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque exitum legis esse in meretrice publicanda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the law would be without proper effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:40:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 40, 118</bibl></cit>, v. the context: <cit><quote lang="la">de exitu rerum sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerto etiam nunc exitu victoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 62, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exitu fortunarum suarum consultabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 77, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 3</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens futuri temporis exitum Caliginosa nocte premit deus,</quote> <trans><tr>events</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 29</bibl></cit>: ut quae rei publicae polliceremur, exitu praestaremus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum rei imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones ad exitum perductae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 19, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exitum spei pervenire,</quote> <trans><tr>accomplishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">serae exitum spei exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine exitu esse,</quote> <trans><tr>without result</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 40, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse haec omnia meliores habebunt exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (responsa haruspicum) aut nullos habuerint exitus aut contrarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 24, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber vota bonos ducit ad exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(fortuna) Belli secundos reddidit exitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 38</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus acta probat,</quote> <trans><tr>the event justifies the deed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exjuro: <entryFree id="n16907" type="hapax" key="exju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-jūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swear solemnly</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 22</bibl>. (The line, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 18</bibl>, found in some edd. is spurious.)</sense></entryFree>
exlecebra: <entryFree id="n16908" type="main" key="exle^ce_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exlĕcē^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. elecebra.</entryFree>
exlex: <entryFree id="n16909" type="main" key="exlex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-lex</orth>, <itype>ēgis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond the law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound by no law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lawless</hi> (only <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> rare but class.): postremo quaero, parebis legibus an non? anne exlex solus vives? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 10, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 22" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 22</bibl>; Liv 9, 34, 8 Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: non quod illi exlegem esse Sullam putarent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectator potus et exlex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 224</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exmoveo: <entryFree id="n16910" type="main" key="exmo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exmŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. emoveo <sense id="n16910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exmucco: <entryFree id="n16911" type="greek" key="exmucco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-mucco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, in mal. part., Inscr. Pompeii in Bullet. Napol. I. p. 68, b.</entryFree>
exobrutus: <entryFree id="n16912" type="hapax" key="exobru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-obrŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [obruo], <sense id="n16912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scraped out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleared out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 34, p. 194</bibl></cit> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
exobsecro: <entryFree id="n16913" type="hapax" key="exobse_^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-obsē^cro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entreat earnestly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicabo, exobsecrabo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>. <cb n="EXON" /></sense></entryFree>
exoccupo: <entryFree id="n16914" type="main" key="exoccu^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-occŭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to discharge of employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from occupation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 65 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exochadium: <entryFree id="n16915" type="greek" key="exo^cha^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏchădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)coxa/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n16915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">external piles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 31</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏchas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)coxa/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 149" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exocoetus: <entryFree id="n16916" type="greek" key="exo_coetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōcoetus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cw/koitos</foreign>, <sense id="n16916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish that sleeps on the shore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 19, 34, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exoculo: <entryFree id="n16917" type="main" key="exo^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŏcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>oculus</etym>, <sense id="n16917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of the eyes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sight</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ni ei caput exoculassitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecam et prorsus exoculatam esse fortunam,</quote> <trans><tr>eyeless</tr>, <tr>sightless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 188, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 207</bibl>, § 8.</sense></entryFree>
exodiarius: <entryFree id="n16918" type="main" key="exo^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exodium</etym>, <sense id="n16918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player in the</hi> exodium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2591</bibl> (of the year A.D. 167); <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 33</bibl>; cf. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exodium: <entryFree id="n16919" type="greek" key="exo^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)co/dion</foreign>. <sense id="n16919.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a piece of a comic description</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a kind of dramatized satura</hi>), <hi rend="ital">for the most part attached to the</hi> Atellanae, <hi rend="ital">but given</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under the emperors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a separate performance after tragedies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 175</bibl> Schol.; 6, 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>; cf. Bernhardy Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 2 ed. p. 341.—</sense><sense id="n16919.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the scenic lang., <hi rend="ital">a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (ante- and post-class.): exodium est finis ... in exodio vitae ... ad exodium adducere <hi rend="ital">or</hi> ducere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 27, 14 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exodium exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 128, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exodoratus: <entryFree id="n16920" type="main" key="exo^do_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏdōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex-odor</etym>, <sense id="n16920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of its smell</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exodus: <entryFree id="n16921" type="greek" key="Exo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Exŏdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ecodos</foreign> (a going out), <sense id="n16921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the second book of Moses</hi> (so called from its narrative of the departure from Egypt), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
exolesco: <entryFree id="n16922" type="main" key="exo^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŏlesco</orth>, <itype>olēvi, ētum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16922.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attain its full size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16922.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., so only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exo-letus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">grown up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full grown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mature</hi>: exoletus qui excessit olescendi id est crescendi modum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=5:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 5, 7</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exoletus qui adolescere (olescere?) id est crescere desiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 80, 12</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">exoleta virgo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Fragm. in Prisc. p. 872</bibl></cit> P.— </sense><sense id="n16922.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., to denote an abandoned youth of ripe age: <cit><quote lang="la">scortum exoletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius, qui semper secum scorta, semper exoletos, semper lupas duceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remiges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16922.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stop growing</hi> (mostly ante-Aug.; perh. not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n16922.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa sunt quae neglegentiā exolescunt et fiunt sterilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 232, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16922.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to grow out of use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of date</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become obsolete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>: exolescentes litterae, <hi rend="ital">disappearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rubbed off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vetustissima Italiae disciplina per desidiam exolesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor validus adeo ut nondum exolescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitus instituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia pascui usu continuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum patris favor haud dum exolevisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum is dolor exoleverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima positio vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exolevit fundendi aeris ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calchedonii in totum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 72</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoletum jam vetustate odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos civitatis (with vetus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et reconditae voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoleta revocavit, aut etiam nova instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exoletus: <entryFree id="n16923" type="main" key="exo^le_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏlētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. exolesco.</entryFree>
exolvo: <entryFree id="n16924" type="main" key="exolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exolvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exsolvo.</entryFree>
exomides: <entryFree id="n16925" type="gloss" key="exo_mi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōmĭdes</orth> <itype>sunt comici vestitus exsertis humeris</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl> (= <foreign lang="greek">e)cwmi/s</foreign>).</entryFree>
exomologesis: <entryFree id="n16926" type="greek" key="exo^mo^lo^ge_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏmŏlŏgēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)comolo/ghsis</foreign>, <sense id="n16926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confession</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Orat. 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exoneratio: <entryFree id="n16927" type="main" key="exo^ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exonero</etym>, <sense id="n16927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unloading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lightening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mercedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exonerator: <entryFree id="n16928" type="gloss" key="exo^ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unloader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1117, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exonero: <entryFree id="n16929" type="main" key="exo^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŏnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to free from a burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disburden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unload</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi><pb n="690" /> <cb n="EXOR" />  (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; in Cic. and Caes. not at all). </sense><sense id="n16929.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; Auct. Afr. 8, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia jactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 44, 61, § 126</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum nausea gravem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbidum corpus (profluvio sanguinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 26, 40, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut exoneratus sentinā (nautilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amnes tantum sed lacus quoque in Padum sese exonerantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenas exonerare colos,</quote> <trans><tr>to empty</tr>, <tr>spin off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:818" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 818</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam ex hoc exoneres agro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to send off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exonerata plebe coloniis deductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo proximas in terras exonerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16929.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exonera civitatem vano forsitan metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parte curae senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum sollicitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exonerata fide mea, quid ultra facere possum, quam uti? etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>exonerated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in quaslibet aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to confide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exonerari laborum meorum partem fateor,</quote> <trans><tr>is discharged</tr>, <tr>removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem convicio,</quote> <trans><tr>to vent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <trans><tr>to clear off</tr>, <tr>pay off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:5:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exonychon: <entryFree id="n16930" type="main" key="exo^ny^cho^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏnychŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)co/nuxon</foreign>, <sense id="n16930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lithospermon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exopinisso: <entryFree id="n16931" type="main" key="exo^pi_nisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŏpīnisso</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to think</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viderint alii quid de hoc exopinissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exoptabilis: <entryFree id="n16932" type="main" key="exopta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exoptābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exopto</etym>, <sense id="n16932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desirable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desired</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:387" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Sat. 26:5" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Sat. 26, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exoptatus: <entryFree id="n16933" type="main" key="exopta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exoptātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exopto.</entryFree>
exopto: <entryFree id="n16934" type="main" key="exopto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-opto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desire greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi> a thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n16934.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae majori parti pulcherrima videntur, ea maxime exoptant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium adventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum exoptavit potius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes te oderunt, tibi pestem exoptant,</quote> <trans><tr>wish you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16934.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> as <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis de causis te exopto quam primum videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulari neglegentiam alicuius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 20</bibl></cit> (but not in Enn. Ann., where the better read. is laudarier optans, v. Vahl. p. 80).—</sense><sense id="n16934.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium hominum exopto ut fiam miserorum miserrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sempiternae laudi tibi sit iste tribunatus exopto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16934.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nobis cupientibus atque exoptantibus fructus otii datus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exoptātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">greatly wished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longed for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol me uxori exoptatum credo adventurum domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiphila, maxume animo exoptata meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exoptatum inimico nuntium primus adferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit et tibi exoptatum optinget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 136</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil exoptatius adventu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mi ere exoptatissume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
exorabilis: <entryFree id="n16935" type="main" key="exo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exoro</etym>. <sense id="n16935.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily entreated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exorable</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si implacabiles iracundiae sunt, summa est acerbitas: sin autem exorabiles, summa levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Orcus) non exorabilis auro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 179</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli exorabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:131" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initium vitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et exorabile numen fortasse experiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 102</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suis quam in alienis exorabilior injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16935.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:782" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 782</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exorabula: <entryFree id="n16936" type="main" key="exo_ra_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōrābŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">means of entreating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convincing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enticements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arguments</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotque exoretur exorabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 360</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exoratio: <entryFree id="n16937" type="main" key="exo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving by entreaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effectual entreaty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 16, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manium paternorum,</quote> <trans><tr>an appeasing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exorativus: <entryFree id="n16938" type="main" key="exo_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prayerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere nescio quid exorativum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 17, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exorator: <entryFree id="n16939" type="hapax" key="exo_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who obtains<cb n="EXOR" />  by entreaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a successful suppliant</hi>, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 2.</sense></entryFree>
exoratrix: <entryFree id="n16940" type="hapax" key="exo_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exorator</etym>, <sense id="n16940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who obtains by entreaty</hi>, Salvian Gub. D. p. 93 Rittersh.</sense></entryFree>
exorbatus: <entryFree id="n16941" type="main" key="exorba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-orbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex-orbo</etym>, <sense id="n16941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">utterly orphaned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereaved</hi>, Rénier, Inscr. Afr. 3981.</sense></entryFree>
exorbitatio: <entryFree id="n16942" type="main" key="exorbi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exorbito</etym>, <sense id="n16942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deviation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transgression</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exorbitator: <entryFree id="n16943" type="main" key="exorbi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorbĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deviator from</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a transgressor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exorbitator et destructor Judaïsmi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exorbito: <entryFree id="n16944" type="main" key="exorbi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-orbĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [orbita] (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n16944.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go out of the track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deviate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16944.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorbitantes boves, qui vehiculum trahebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 22:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 22, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellis exorbitare a praestitutis itineribus non licet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16944.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a regula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a catholicae fidei regulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16944.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn out of the track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn aside;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a tramite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exorcismus: <entryFree id="n16945" type="greek" key="exorcismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorcismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)corkismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exorcism</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exorcismis fugare daemones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exorcista: <entryFree id="n16946" type="greek" key="exorcista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorcista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)corkisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exorcist</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl>; Firm. Math. 3, 5; 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exorcizo: <entryFree id="n16947" type="greek" key="exorci_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorcīzo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)corki/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n16947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive away evil spirits by adjuration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exorcise</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 10:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exordior: <entryFree id="n16948" type="main" key="exordi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ordĭor</orth>, <itype>orsus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n16948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin a web</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay the warp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weave</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16948.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">funem longum pedes LXXII.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:135:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 135, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: neque exordiri primum, unde occipias, habes, Neque detexundam ad telam certos terminos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pertexe modo, Antoni, quod exorsus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16948.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, esp. a speech; constr. with the <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16948.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (so perh. not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutias adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rem facete et callide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ab causa tam nefanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum ingenti spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoediam magno impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidia et caedes a Claudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16948.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">imitabor ergo Aratum, qui magnis de rebus dicere exordiens, a Jove incipiendum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc dicere exorsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:49:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 49, 101</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n16948.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aut ab adversarii dicto exordiemur, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ipsa re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veritate, a dignitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16948.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla hoc pacto exordiri coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubent exordiri ita, ut eum, qui audiat, benevolum nobis faciamus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ita, quasi, etc., Quint. prooem. § 4: in hunc modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his verbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 38</bibl></cit>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">exorsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commenced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorsa tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 4, 116</bibl></cit>; Visell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiunt ea, quibus ante exorsa et potius detexta prope retexantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 158</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exorsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ambages et longa exorsa aliquem tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>a long preamble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua cuique exorsa laborem Fortunamque ferent,</quote> <trans><tr>beginning</tr>, <tr>undertaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 111</bibl></cit> (opp. exitus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exordium: <entryFree id="n16949" type="main" key="exordi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exordĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exordior, I.</etym>. <sense id="n16949.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the warp of a web</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">non possum togam praetextam sperare, cum exordium pullum videam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16949.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi> (the usual meaning; syn.: initium, principium, primordium): neve inde navis inchoandae exordium Coepisset, quae, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 282 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hujus quoque exordium mali, quoniam principium boni diximus, explicemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: institutae rei publicae clarum ac tam omnibus notum, id. <cb n="EXOR" /> Rep. 2, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">a qua totius vitae ducat exor dium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus tempo ribus scribendi capiat exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene ab exordio Urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertius (annus) a prima vigilia sumens exordium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 114</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priva animaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis lunaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primae pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16949.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe animadverti, summos oratores in dicendi exordio permoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ita nascetur exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—As part of a speech or writing, <hi rend="ital">the introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exordium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proëm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preface</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">prooemium, praefatio, prologus): exordium est principium orationis, per quod animus auditoris aut judicis constituitur vel apparatur ad audiendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique id, quod primum est dicendum, postremum soleo cogitare, quo utar exordio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus liber a prima parte, id est exordio incipiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:19" default="NO">1, 12, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exordio pro Milone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:74" default="NO">9, 4, 74</bibl> et saep.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:161" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae prima exordia sumat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16949.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treatise</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:1" default="NO">7, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:1 al" default="NO">7, 12, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exoriens: <entryFree id="n16950" type="main" key="exo^ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exŏrĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. exorior, I. A. b.</entryFree>
exorior: <entryFree id="n16951" type="main" key="exo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>ortus, 3 and 4</itype> (<sense id="n16951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut. act.</hi> exorturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 17:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 17, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—The <hi rend="ital">praes. indic.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi> acc. to the third <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:904 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 904 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoreretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27, 3</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>—v. orior), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi> (esp. suddenly, unexpectedly), <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16951.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n16951.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">post solstitium Canicula exoritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoriens sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 438</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubare exorto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu sola exorere, quae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>spring up</tr>, <tr>start up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 124</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16951.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Part. praes. subst.</hi>, exoriens (sc. sol), <hi rend="ital">the rising sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the morning</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qua venit exoriens, qua deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 27</bibl></cit> (4, 4, 27 M.).—To designate a cardinal point, <hi rend="ital">the orient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantaria facito ab exoriente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16951.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoritur Antipatri ratio ex altera parte,</quote> <trans><tr>springs</tr>, <tr>arises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Julia de vi adversus eos exoritur, qui vim commiserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:18:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nunc paulum exorior, et maxime quidem iis litteris, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>recover myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16951.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16951.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nilus) exoriens penitus media ab regione diei,</quote> <trans><tr>arising</tr>, <tr>proceeding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e terraque exorta repente arbusta salirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 187</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse novas assignationes instituit et repentinus Sulla nobis exoritur,</quote> <trans><tr>arises</tr>, <tr>appears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic repente anuli beneficio rex exortus est Lydiae (Gyges),</quote> <trans><tr>became</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoriare aliquis nostris ex ossibus ultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 625</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16951.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum, quod ex virtutibus exoritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horum (decemvirum) ex injustitia subito exorta est maxima perturbatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot bella repente aliis ex locis exorta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>started up</tr>, <tr>arose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 40, 7</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">a Myrrhina haec sunt exorta omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeded from</tr>, <tr>are owing to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorti utero dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito exorta est nefaria Catonis promulgatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
