C. 2, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cum contingit, amor exoriatur necesse est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias exorta aliqua offensione dirumpimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoritur trepidos inter discordia cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 583</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 313</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 128: de Praenestinorum defectione fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21, 9 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exormiston: <entryFree id="n16952" type="gloss" key="exormiston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exormiston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cormisto/n</foreign>, <sense id="n16952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, perh. a kind of muraena, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exornatio: <entryFree id="n16953" type="main" key="exorna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exornātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exorno</etym>, <sense id="n16953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adorning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16953.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quae ad lavationem, quae ad exornationem pertinerent, <hi rend="ital">to the toilet</hi>, Col. (Cic. Oecon.?) 12, 3, 2.—</sense><sense id="n16953.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">embellishment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16953.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa inventa exponentur simpliciter sine ulla exornatione (corresp. to expolitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum et sententiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16953.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a figure of speech., Auct. Her. <pb n="691" /> <cb n="EXOR" /> 4, 8, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:3:10 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 3, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
exornator: <entryFree id="n16954" type="hapax" key="exorna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exornātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adorner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellisher.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri non exornatores rerum, sed tantummodo narratores fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exornatus: <entryFree id="n16955" type="main" key="exorna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exorno.</entryFree>
exorno: <entryFree id="n16956" type="main" key="exorno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-orno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply with</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n16956.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): nullae magis res duae plus negoti habent (sc. quam navis et mulier) forte si occeperis exornare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give them an outfit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vicinitatem armis exornat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veste, nummis, familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is homo exornetur graphice in peregrinum modum,</quote> <trans><tr>be fitted out</tr>, <tr>dressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus paratis atque exornatis nuptiis,</quote> <trans><tr>set out</tr>, <tr>arranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium omni opulentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul omnibus exploratis, credo dis fretus ... tamen pro rei copia satis providenter exornat,</quote> <trans><tr>provides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl></cit> Kritz. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem exornavit, mulierem qui abduceret,</quote> <trans><tr>has employed</tr>, <tr>fitted out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 110</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum aliquem exornari oportuit, qui istaec prohiberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n16956.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to deck out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi> (the class. signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n16956.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea signa emere soleo, quae ad similitudinem gymnasiorum exornent mihi in palaestra locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domum ejus exornatam atque instructam iste reddiderat nudam atque inanem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium ample magnificeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">62: aliquem veste regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi me exorno ut placeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 15</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, comically: adeo exornatum dabo, adeo depexum, ut dum vivat, meminerit mei, <hi rend="ital">I'll give him such a dressing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16956.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu te exornas moribus lepidis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras exornavit eam Graeciam, quae magna dicta est, praestantissimis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam falsa gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Fulvius eodem honore (i. e. consulatu) exornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illustrandam atque exornandam orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 152</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea ratio in dicendo haec esse solet, ut boni quod habeat, id amplectar, exornem, exaggerem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 72, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid exornamus philosophiam? aut quid ejus nomine gloriosi sumus?</quote> <trans><tr>set off with praises</tr>, <tr>extol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16956.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To despoil of ornament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 9</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">decked out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">candide vestitus, laute exornatusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cithara exornatissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: ornatu nullo potest exornatior esse, Poët. in Anth. Lat. 1, 692 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
exoro: <entryFree id="n16957" type="main" key="exo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n16957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. praes. pass.</hi> exorarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 167</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade by entreaty; to gain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obtain by entreaty</hi> (class.): quem ego, ut mentiatur, inducere possum; <cit><quote lang="la">ut pejeret, exorare facile potero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc te exoremus necesse est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl></cit>: Brutus et Cassius utinam ... per te exorentur, ne, etc., Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego patrem exoravi ... tibi ne noceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restat Chremes, qui mihi exorandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 140</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Sine te exorem. <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Exores tu me? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Ego quidem ab hoc certe exorabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine te exorarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorant magnos carmina saepe deos,</quote> <trans><tr>i. e. soften</tr>, <tr>appease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos (tura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lares farre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum toties,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae patrem frequentibus litteris,</quote> <trans><tr>to reconcile the father to the daughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a filii caede precibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissuade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnatam ut det, oro, vixque id exoro,</quote> <trans><tr>I obtain it</tr>, <tr>prevail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res quaedam'st, quam volo Ego me abs te exorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vicinos concidere loris exorata solet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>although implored</tr>, <tr>in spite of entreaties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:415" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem divum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXOS" /> 11, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">exoratae arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 591</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam edepol quisquam me exorabit, quin eloquar, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.—With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc veniam illis sine te exorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum exorare vos sinite nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum diem deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:5:122" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 5, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem exorata fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 700</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorando, haud advorsando sumendam operam censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exors: <entryFree id="n16958" type="main" key="exors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exors</orth>, <itype>ortis</itype>, v. exsors.</entryFree>
exorsus: <entryFree id="n16959" type="main" key="exorsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exordior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16960" type="hapax" key="exorsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exorsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exordior</etym>, <sense id="n16960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exortivus: <entryFree id="n16961" type="main" key="exorti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exortīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. exortus</etym>. <sense id="n16961.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the rising</hi> of the heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">ascendant</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16961.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">towards the sunrise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eastern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 39</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Narbonensis Galliae exortiva,</quote> <trans><tr>the eastern part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exortus: <entryFree id="n16962" type="main" key="exortus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exorior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16963" type="main" key="exortus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exortus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exorior</etym>, <sense id="n16963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 22, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 11, 23, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab occasu solis ad exortus intenderent iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exos: <entryFree id="n16964" type="main" key="exo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ŏs</orth>, <itype>ossis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without bones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boneless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 721</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exosculatio: <entryFree id="n16965" type="main" key="exoscu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exoscŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exosculor</etym>, <sense id="n16965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mutual kissing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbarum,</quote> <trans><tr>billing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 12, 15, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exosculor: <entryFree id="n16966" type="main" key="exoscu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-oscŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n16966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kiss eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kiss fondly</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16966.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ac diu exosculatus adolescentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum uxoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus cum fletu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16966.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to praise greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admire</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiam rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2, 17</bibl> B.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">exoscŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kissed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia deae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 154, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exossis: <entryFree id="n16967" type="main" key="exossis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exossis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">exossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex-ŏs</etym>, <sense id="n16967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without bones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boneless</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n16967.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit (lepus marinus) cetera exossis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 300, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16967.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16967.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exossis plane et enervis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enervam et exossam saltationem explicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Met. 1, p. 104, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16967.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exosso: <entryFree id="n16968" type="main" key="exosso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exosso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of the bones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum ni hic me quasi muraenam exossare cogitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">congrum, muraenam exdorsua ... exossata fac sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 162</bibl>.—Hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to break the power of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make helpless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:50:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 50, 17</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: exossato pectore, <hi rend="ital">boneless</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">flexible</hi> (cf. exos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1271</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exossatus ager,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without stones</tr>, <tr>cleared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:51" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exostra: <entryFree id="n16969" type="greek" key="exo_stra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōstra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cw/stra</foreign>. <sense id="n16969.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A machine in the theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the back part of the stage was turned towards the spectators;</hi> transf. of any thing <hi rend="ital">public</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum jam in exostra helluatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16969.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hanging bridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applied by besiegers to the walls of a besieged city</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exosus: <entryFree id="n16970" type="main" key="exo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-ōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [odi]. <sense id="n16970.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hating exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detesting</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">si nondum exosus ad unum Trojanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 818</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrios mores exosus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (late Lat.): vitae hujus exosa, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 2, 4.—</sense><sense id="n16970.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hated exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">diis exosos esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo digna omnium ordinum detestatione exoso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob scelera universis exosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exosum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 13, 15</bibl></cit> al. <cb n="EXPA" /></sense></entryFree>
exotericus: <entryFree id="n16971" type="greek" key="exo_te^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōtĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cwteriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">external</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exoteric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri (opp. acroatici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 2</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
exoticus: <entryFree id="n16972" type="greek" key="exo_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)cwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exotic</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n16972.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus (piscium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 278, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Met. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia, i. q. magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16972.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exōtĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foreign garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expallesco: <entryFree id="n16973" type="main" key="expallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pallesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn very pale</hi> (perh. occurring only in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">viden' ut expalluit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 602</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:539 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 539 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erubuisse, expalluisse, titubasse ... signa conscientiae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindarici fontis qui non expalluit haustus,</quote> <trans><tr>who feared not to drink</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:146" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expalliatus: <entryFree id="n16974" type="hapax" key="expalli^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pallĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pallium</etym>, <sense id="n16974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">robbed of his cloak</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expallidus: <entryFree id="n16975" type="main" key="expalli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pallĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exceedingly pale</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wan</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit> (al. pallido): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus frigidum et expallidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expalmo: <entryFree id="n16976" type="main" key="expalmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-palmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to slap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">box</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">r(api/zw</foreign>, ex-palmo, Gloss.: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 56, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expalpo: <entryFree id="n16977" type="main" key="expalpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expalpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">expalpor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n16977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obtain by coaxing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exora, blandire, expalpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 144</bibl></cit>: si quid expalpare possim ab illo, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 12</bibl>: nunc servus argentum a patre expalpabitur, Plaut. Fragm, ap. Non. ib., and 476, 24.</sense></entryFree>
expalponides: <entryFree id="n16978" type="main" key="expalpo^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expalpŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. nummosexpalponides.</entryFree>
expalpor: <entryFree id="n16979" type="main" key="expalpor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expalpor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. expalpo.</entryFree>
expando: <entryFree id="n16980" type="main" key="expando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pando</orth>, <itype>pandi, pansum or passum</itype> (the former, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:70" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 37, § 70</bibl>; the latter, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 15, 2</bibl>; but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl>, very dub., the more prob. reading being exapertae, v. Orell. ad h. l.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expand</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n16980.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: haec nuntiasse et flammeum expassum domi, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes supra fontem frigidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera circa navim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 37, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas (grues),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas sub umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">vagus ille, cum expanditur, amnis (Nilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16980.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturam dictis,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay open</tr>, <tr>unfold</tr>, <tr>explain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expansio: <entryFree id="n16981" type="main" key="expansi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expansĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expando</etym>, <sense id="n16981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spreading out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expansion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:139" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expansus: <entryFree id="n16982" type="main" key="expansus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expansus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from expando.</entryFree>
expapillatus: <entryFree id="n16983" type="hapax" key="expa^pilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-păpillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>papilla</etym>, <sense id="n16983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bared to the breast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expapillato brachio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 44</bibl></cit> (quasi usque ad papillam renudato, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 103, 4</bibl>); v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
expartus: <entryFree id="n16984" type="hapax" key="expartus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-partus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pario</etym>, of female animals, <sense id="n16984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">past bearing</hi>: pecudes, Varr. R. R, 2, 5, 7, p. 181 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
expassus: <entryFree id="n16985" type="main" key="expassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from expando.</entryFree>
expatare: <entryFree id="n16986" type="gloss" key="expatare"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expatare</orth> <itype>in locum patentem se dare, sive in spatium se conferre</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80, 5</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n16986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
expatior: <entryFree id="n16987" type="main" key="expa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expătĭor</orth>, <itype>ti</itype>, v. exspatior.</entryFree>
expatricius: <entryFree id="n16988" type="main" key="expa_^tri^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pā^trĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has ceased to be a patrician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ex-patrician</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 24, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expatro: <entryFree id="n16989" type="hapax" key="expa_^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pā^tro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to squander in voluptuousness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expausatus: <entryFree id="n16990" type="hapax" key="expausa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pausātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pausa], <sense id="n16990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rested</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refreshed</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">jumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expavefacio: <entryFree id="n16991" type="main" key="expa^ve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-păvĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to terrify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make afraid</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mugitu tauri equi expavefacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 47" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 47</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 41</bibl>, read expavescentia).</sense></entryFree>
expaveo: <entryFree id="n16992" type="main" key="expa^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-păvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be sorely afraid of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc audaciam stili nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expavesco: <entryFree id="n16993" type="main" key="expa^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-păvesco</orth>, <itype>pāvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become greatly terrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very</hi> <pb n="692" /> <cb n="EXPE" /> <hi rend="ital">much afraid; to be greatly frightened at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">afraid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear greatly</hi> (perh. not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n16993.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">expavescentibus repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: ad tumultum aliquem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 75, 97, § 209</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad id expavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres a primo conspectu ejus expavescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 36, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 33 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16993.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua praeter modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebriter ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem adulantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigusque famemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:361" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres moles (Rhodanus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:464" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, ut crimen ingens, expavescendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expavidus: <entryFree id="n16994" type="hapax" key="expa^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-păvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n16994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">terrified greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae magnitudine ictus expavidusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expectatio: <entryFree id="n16995" type="main" key="expecta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expectātio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expecto</orth>, etc., v. exspect-.</entryFree>
expectoro: <entryFree id="n16996" type="main" key="expecto^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pectŏro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pectus</etym>, <sense id="n16996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive from the breast; to expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish from the mind</hi> (ante-class.): tum pavor sapientiam omnem mi exanimato expectorat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. ed. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 17</bibl>): pavorem hunc meum expectora, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 8</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. ed. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 175</bibl> and 213).</sense></entryFree>
expeculiatus: <entryFree id="n16997" type="hapax" key="expe^cu_li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pĕcūlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peculium</etym>, <sense id="n16997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stripped of property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expedio: <entryFree id="n16998" type="main" key="expe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (archaic <sense id="n16998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> expedibo, Enn., Pac., Att., and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">477, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 36</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pes</etym>, orig., <hi rend="ital">to free the feet</hi>, i. e. from a snare; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to extricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberate</hi> any thing entangled, involved (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.; syn.: extrico, enodo, enucleo, explico, expono, interpretor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16998.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte, in quot se laqueos induerit, quorum ex nullo se umquam expediet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">106: mortis laqueis caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: vix illigatum te triformi Pegasus expediet Chimaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam inter et hostes Expedior,</quote> <trans><tr>make my way through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantem nemori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:669" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 669</bibl></cit> et saep.—With inanim. and abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus expediunt,</quote> <trans><tr>open a passage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter fugae per invias rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum saxosum lectione lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: capillus pectine quotidie expediendus est, <hi rend="ital">disentangled</hi>, Fronto de Eloqu. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n16998.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16998.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fetch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi> any thing folded up, put away, etc.: funes expediunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 297, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem nudari et virgas expediri jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cererem canistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia mediis tectis (famulae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:341" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 341</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria pastoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to provide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces suas (institor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 422</bibl></cit>: pecuniam, <hi rend="ital">to procure</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 298, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold in readiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 592</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela equosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas in occulto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G 7, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se celeriter (Galli equites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: exercitum expediri ad bellum jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16998.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">to send away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">me ex suis locis pulcre ornatum expedivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: saepe disco, Saepe trans finem jaculo nobilis expedito, <hi rend="ital">despatched</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hurled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16998.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, for expedire se, <hi rend="ital">to arm one's self for battle</hi> (only in Tac.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos secum expedire jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 88</bibl></cit>; 2, 99.</sense><sense id="n16998.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> from any evil, obstacle, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">impeditum animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis est, cum stultitiā suā impeditus sit, quoquo modo possit, se expedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haererem, nisi tu me expedisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex servitute filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab omni occupatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem omni molestiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se aerumnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se crimine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem malis obsidionalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: amor Lycisci me <cb n="EXPE" /> tenet, Unde expedire non queant amicorum consilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 25</bibl>: curae sagaces Expediunt (Claudiae manus) per acuta belli, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">help through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 76</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per quot discrimina rerum Expedior?</quote> <trans><tr>escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:217" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me multa impediverunt quae ne nunc quidem expedita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vita nostra in aliquas insidias incidisset, omnis honesta ratio esset expediendae salutis,</quote> <trans><tr>of obtaining safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16998.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16998.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Antonio loquare velim, et rem, ut poteris, expedias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedire et conficere res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frumentariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia (with explicare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina mea, per deos, expedi, exsolve,</quote> <trans><tr>settle</tr>, <tr>pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Faberianum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. in a pun respecting a scholar unable to pay his debts: omnes solvere posse quaestiones, Unum difficile expedire nomen, Bibacul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum expediam exitum hujus institutae orationis, non reperio,</quote> <trans><tr>settle</tr>, <tr>arrange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expediri quae restant vix poterunt. si hoc relinqueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docte hanc fallaciam,</quote> <trans><tr>put into operation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16998.9" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrate</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic., Cæs., or Quint.): qui tu misera's? mi expedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit> (639 Ritschl): id ego aequum ac jus fecisse expedibo atque eloquar, <hi rend="ital">will show</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Pac., Att.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 15 sq" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 15 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, hoc mihi expedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius omnem Expediam prima repetens ab origine famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca tibi e multis ... expediam dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam hujuscemodi rei initium expedio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc originem, mores, et quo facinore dominationem raptum ierit, expediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me non tantum praevisa, sed subita expedire docuisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea de caede quam verissime expediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptius expediam quot, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it will take me a shorter time to recount</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:220" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 220</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16998.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Reflex.</hi> of events, <hi rend="ital">to develop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run their course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris arteis eloquar quem ad modum se expediant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res vostrorum omnium bene expedire voltis,</quote> <trans><tr>to make favorable progress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 5</bibl></cit> (Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 36</bibl>; but Ussing reads me expedire, <hi rend="ital">benefit me</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n16998.11" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, res expedit, or <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, expedit (alicui—lit., it helps out, furthers, promotes; hence), <hi rend="ital">it is serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expedient</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nequiter paene expedivit prima parasitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur faciat, dixerit quis, quod utile sit, quod expediat? Immo intelligat, nihil nec expedire nec utile esse, quod sit injustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid intersit sua, quid expediat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex utilitatis varietatibus, cum aliis aliud expediat, nasci discordias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non idem expediret, incidere saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquam Caesari ad diuturnitatem victoriae et dominationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non idem ipsis expedire et multitudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—With an <hi rend="ital">inf. clause</hi> as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">expedit bonas esse vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus bonis expedit salvam esse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (reo) damnari expediret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eam (pecuniam) in praediis collocari maxime expediret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vinci necesse est, expedit cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 9</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">subj. clause</hi> as subject after <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">expedire omnibus dicunt, ut singulae civitates suas leges habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 1, 7</bibl></cit> Benecke ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">expedit rei publicae, ne sua re quis male utatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque expedire ut ambitione aliena trahatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si ita expedit, velim quamprimum conscendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic magis expedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut expediat causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pĕdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unimpeded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unincumbered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at hand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16998.12" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteris quae habebat vadimonia differt, ut expeditus in Galliam proficisci posset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: incrmos armati, impeditos expediti interficiunt,<cb n="EXPE" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">without baggage</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 58, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo circiter hominum numero XVI. milia expedita cum omni equitatu Ariovistus misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones expeditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 42, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of soldiers without baggage,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; 6, 25, 1; 1, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">expĕdī-tus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier lightly burdened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swiftly marching soldier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo (silvae) novem dierum iter expedito patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam fit ei Clodius expeditus in equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Sagana,</quote> <trans><tr>tucked up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedito nobis homine et parato opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>ready</tr>, <tr>at hand</tr>, <tr>prompt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditus ad caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pronuntiandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et expeditus ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n16998.13" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. or abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">convenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis expedito loco actuaria navigia relinquit,</quote> <trans><tr>commodious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">via expeditior ad honores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 41, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum in caelum patere optimo et justissimo cuique expeditissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia expeditissima quae erat, tibi decreta est,</quote> <trans><tr>the readiest</tr>, <tr>the nearest at hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena (with parca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditissimum unguentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probabili expedito, soluto, libero, nullā re implicato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedita erat et perfacile currens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 63, 227</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expedita ac profluens dicendi celeritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inops ad ornandum, sed ad inveniendum expedita Hermagorae disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope jam expeditam Caesaris victoriam interpellaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>achieved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n16998.14" n="b" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: in expedito esse, habere, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have in readiness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam sunt quidem in animo, sed parum prompta: quae incipiunt in expedito esse, quum dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">promptum hoc et in expedito positum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in expedito haberent integras copias ad opem ferendam,</quote> <trans><tr>ready for action</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pĕdīte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without impediment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promptly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis rebus celeriter expediteque percipiendis, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedite explicans quod proposuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulatu's,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non implicite et abscondite, sed patentius et expeditius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit putatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo te, quocumque opus erit, facillime et expeditissime conferas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expedite: <entryFree id="n16999" type="main" key="expe^di_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĕdītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. expedio, <sense id="n16999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
expeditio: <entryFree id="n17000" type="main" key="expe^di_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĕdītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expedio</etym>. <sense id="n17000.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an enterprise against the enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an expedition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">campaign</hi>: tripartito milites equitesque in expeditionem misit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10, 1</bibl>; cf.: in expeditionem exercitum educere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:34:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 34, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 6, 12, § 24 al.</bibl>— * </sense><sense id="n17000.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">apes noctu deprehensae in expeditione, excubant supinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17000.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhetoric. * </sense><sense id="n17000.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An unfolding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">developing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet paucis comprehensa brevitas multarum rerum expeditionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 68</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17000.4" n="B" level="2"> A figure of speech, <hi rend="ital">a despatching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 29, 40</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17000.5" n="III" level="1"> In architect., <hi rend="ital">an arranging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparing</hi> of buildings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 5</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
expeditionalis: <entryFree id="n17001" type="main" key="expe^di_ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĕdītĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>expeditio, I.</etym>, <sense id="n17001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a military expedition</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nigr. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: portus, Cod. Th. 8, 10, 11.</sense></entryFree>
expeditus: <entryFree id="n17002" type="main" key="expe^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĕdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from expedio.</entryFree>
expejuro: <entryFree id="n17003" type="main" key="expe_ju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expējūro</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swear falsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perjure one's self</hi>: expejurabant, execrabant se ac suos, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 24</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 188</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
expello: <entryFree id="n17004" type="main" key="expello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pello</orth>, <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17004.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tanta virtus ex hac urbe expelletur, exterminabitur, proicietur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 37, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsus atque ejectus e praedio Quinctius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exturbari et expelli plebem ex agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: a patria, id.
